課程概述
*** We welcome and encourage all sophomore students to take this course.   All the necessary fundamental backgrounds will be covered.  :)  ***
This course offers an in-depth exploration of parallel computing, a field of increasing significance in contemporary computer science. As the number of processor cores in both server and desktop environments continues to grow, the challenge of efficiently harnessing these abundant computational resources has become paramount. The course addresses this challenge by providing students with a comprehensive understanding of parallel programming paradigms and the underlying architectures of parallel multi-core processors, including both Central Processing Units (CPUs) and Graphics Processing Units (GPUs).
The curriculum is structured to progress from fundamental concepts to advanced topics in parallel computing. Students will acquire not only software-related skills crucial for writing efficient parallel programs but also gain insights into the hardware architectures that support parallelism. This dual focus enables students to develop strategies for accelerating existing programs, optimizing the utilization of computational resources, and enhancing the computation-to-communication ratio — all critical factors in maximizing system performance.
Throughout the course, emphasis will be placed on practical applications of parallel computing principles. Students will engage with real-world scenarios that demonstrate the importance of parallel programming in addressing complex computational problems. The course will also explore current trends and future directions in parallel computing, preparing students for the evolving landscape of high-performance computing.
By the conclusion of this course, students will possess a robust foundation in parallel computing, equipped with the knowledge and skills necessary to design, implement, and optimize parallel algorithms across a variety of computational platforms. This expertise will position students at the forefront of a critical area in computer science, ready to tackle the computational challenges of the future.
課程目標
The primary objectives of this course are to instruct students in understanding the concepts of parallel computing, the principles of parallel programming, and the hardware and software architectures associated with parallel computation.
課程要求
*** We welcome and encourage all sophomore students to take this course.   All the necessary fundamental backgrounds will be covered.  :)  ***
The students who intend to take this course has to possess C/C++ programming skills, as well as the background knowledge of "introduction to computers".

課程概述
English Writing for Academic Pursuit familiarizes students with academic writing skills (e.g., summarizing, paraphrasing, paragraph structuring) and with respect to study-related genres: cover letters, curriculum vitae, autobiography, and SoP. Students will be provided with opportunities to cultivate their writing capabilities; to this end, students will be engaged in authentic case analyses and hands-on writing tasks via collaborative learning.
欲加選本課的同學請留意：本課加退選制度採電腦自動加退選，搭配第一周出席的同學可登記候補名單，於第三周線上加退選結束之後，視實際選課人數，酌量開放名額抽籤，以人工加簽的方式加選本課。僅限第一周有出席登記名單的同學可參與抽籤。
課程目標
This course enables students to produce a portfolio where they adopt the learned skills to produce their study-related documents and tailor the writing to their target audiences. The ultimate goal is to encourage students to marry their inner selves with their professional images, to put their personal interests into professional perspectives, and to map out their academic visions and ambitions in light of accessible resources.

課程概述
Even though the majority of the Earth's surface is covered by seawater, the average person is less aware of what is happening in the ocean than what is happening on land. In this course, we will work together to answer several fundamental questions:
Which factors control life in the ocean? How do we know what we know about the ocean? What's at the bottom of the ocean? How does the water in the ocean move? How are human activities and climate change altering the ocean? OCEA 10 provides an introduction to the ocean environment, including geological, chemical, physical, and biological oceanography topics.
課程目標
Course Goals:
•	Students will be able to increase their understanding of the geology, chemistry, physics, and biology of the oceans.
•	Students will understand how Taiwan's proximity to the ocean influences its weather, economy, natural hazards, and the lives of its residents.
•	Students will understand how the Earth's oceans, atmosphere, and glaciers influence one another, how these parts of the Earth system are changing, and how past and present civilizations have adapted to climate variability and climate change.
•	Students will become comfortable making qualitative and quantitative observations.
•	Students will gain familiarity reading and interpreting maps, photographs, cross-sections, graphs, and other data.
•	Students will become aware of the impact that their actions have on the marine environment.

課程概述
★★★本課程為密集課程，上課時間為星期一晚間6:00~9:00，上課日期請見下方課程進度。
★★★本課程初選不開放，修課申請表：https://forms.gle/msEPxo7z1B5KQk1Y9   ，修課申請自8/1起至8/24止，詳細修課申請方式請見下方課程要求說明。
協助學生探索潛能、翻轉學習，讓學生成為改變社會的未來領導者。學生職業生涯發展中心開設「打造未來領袖」學分課程，結合專業顧問團隊DDI美商宏智與企業業師產學共育，提升學生溝通力、適應力、輔導力、就業力、持續力、決策力，搭建產學共育人才的平台，為臺灣打造永續人才競爭力。
一、課程特色：
(一)	領導潛能測評：
•	在正式課程開始前，學生可獲得市價2625元的潛+能 (Potential Plus) 線上測驗。
•	運用測驗果進行詳細的回饋及分析，幫助學生加深自我認知，發揮個人優勢，快速提升不足之處。
(二)	混合學習模式：
•	線上主題學習結合實體翻轉課堂，幫助學生掌握關鍵領導能力。
•	課後設計與社團和職場場景相結合的實踐任務，強化學習成效。
(三)	企業業師Coach團隊：
•	11位來自知名企業的主管將加入課程Coach團隊，手把手指導。
•	與學生討論實務中的領導和團隊合作難題，提供寶貴的經驗和見解。

課程目標
一、	通過科學且體系化之方法遴選有潛力有意願成為領導者之學生。並加速提升未來領導力。採用全球效度最高之評鑑中心手法，一方面能選出一批高動力學員並提高他們的自我能力認知。
二、	透過結合專業顧問團隊與企業導師產學共育，後續結合社團經驗實際應用所學且接受業師實際輔導之多元混成學習，引導學生做出心態與行為改變，學以致用。
三、	徵選有意願的優秀學生，全面瞭解企業所需領導力之關鍵範疇與內容，通過挑戰性任務充分鍛煉自己的能力，提升視野與格局，養成積極且正向的心態，成為擁抱未來之未來領導者、為進入全球職場做準備。
課程要求
一、本課程市值百萬，且有機會直接與企業主管交流對話，資源寶貴，請同學把握修課機會
二、本門課程以中文教材授課

課程概述
全球在可耕地日趨縮減、環境資源(如:水、能源等)短缺，人口卻急遽增加的情況下，糧食不足的隱憂成了急需面對的議題。相對應的技術學門，致力於其解決之道，因此富比士雜誌於2012年，將農業工程列為未來20年中，最具發展前景的十大主修科目之一。技術發展以增加產量的同時，如何減少因農業活動對環境所造成的衝擊，也是一大課題。本課程旨在介紹如何協助農業在因時、因地制宜之條件下，輔以相關技術，整合專家、資訊系統(如:物聯網應用、生產力4.0)，發展出提升產量、質量，並兼顧環境永續性的未來農業。
課程目標
幫助學生了解全球農業在不同氣候、地形、及環境限制下發展出來的豐富多元性，並認識可應用之相關生物、感測、控制技術。引導學生腦力激盪、發揮想像力，發想農業的未來可能性。啟發學生對全球問題的關心，及對人、動物、土地的關懷。
課程要求
課堂介紹該週主題 ，影片觀賞及相關資料導讀 ，討論與腦力激盪 。學期中搭配溫室(或植物工廠)、傳統農場、或加工工廠 (三擇二) 參觀，以助學生了解農場設施、病蟲害防治、環境監控、栽培暨收穫技術，及其他實際操作面可能遇到之現實問題。

本課程主要在介紹人類社會發展與環境變遷、科技進步、生物產業發展之間的關係。藉由當代重要的社會發展理論之探討，如現代化理論、結構依賴理論與世界體系理論，並在永續發展的理念下，引導同學反思人類社會發展的極限與可能的替代途徑。重要的研討議題，包含經濟成長、環境正義、環境倫理、氣候變遷、科技風險社會、食品安全、糧食安全、永續發展指標，以及提升國民幸福導向的另類社會發展。
課程目標
1. 介紹社會發展理論。 2. 探討社會發展政策相關議題。 3.引薦社會發展議題研討。

核心能力關聯

課程大綱
為確保您我的權利,請尊重智慧財產權及不得非法影印
課程概述
兩位教授曾雪峰（腦開刀、感染、癱瘓被宣告不治）與宋玫玫（中年中風、導致中度身障）由於自己的生命突然遭受重大巨變，而深刻體會出面對無可抗拒的挫折時，從中培養接受打擊不屈不撓的軟性力量、以及重新站起之能力的重要性，因此想開此新課，與學生一同探索「軟強」的概念，探討軟強或回彈力（resilience）的重要性，以及如何在自身生命中找到軟強回彈力的來源。
台灣社會的文化向來頌揚傑出、剛強，詞彙中總是將「堅」與「強」、「軟」與「弱」併聯在一起，強調優秀者要堅強維持自身優勢，取得人生勝利組的最佳位置，方有光明幸福的未來。然而人生道上不可能沒有挫折，尤其台大學生天資聰穎，求學過程中普遍表現傑出，在面對挫敗、創傷時，克服的能力則可能普遍較缺乏。如何在每一次的挫敗經驗之中找到讓自己更茁壯的回彈力，是本課程希望帶給即將離開校園舒適圈、進入社會迎戰未知挑戰的同學的素養。
除了藉由他人經驗的啟發之外，本課程並將運用 a) 自由書寫 及 b) 未來思考中之Causal Layered Analysis 二大工具、以及搭配課程進行的小作業，協助同學探尋自身內在的力量，並翻轉建構出能夠幫助未來自己 (future self) 的圖像。

課程目標
本課程中心主旨在引導學生思考回答這個問題：
“If unexpected catastrophes suddenly occur, would you be resilient to face the new challenge?”  （「如果悲慘的意外無預警地發生，你是否有足夠的韌性面對突如其來的變局？」）
「培養面對巨變的軟強力量」
藉由實際探究與討論，學生將更能夠：
1. 思考體會如何面對巨大挫折；
2. 面對突如其來的變故時，練習調適自我；
3. 培養健康面對失敗與挫折的態度。

課程大綱
為確保您我的權利,請尊重智慧財產權及不得非法影印
課程概述
本課程從全球治理及政治經濟學的視角來討探永續金融及ESG的發展。這門課的結構可分作兩大部分。課程第一部分主要關注永續金融在制度層次上的設計、運作及影響，涵蓋主題包括永續金融的概念發展、碳定價政策的運作、中央銀行的角色、永續發展債券的運作，以及針對歐盟、亞洲國家和台灣的個案研究。課程的第二部分則是聚焦ESG在企業層次上的運作及影響。本課程除課堂授課外，也包含專題演講，以期增進修課同學對個案及實務的理解。
課程目標
在完成本課程後，學生將具備以下能力：
1.	理解永續金融及ESG的學術研究及實務，並能應用核心概念及現有的分析架構
2.	能對學術論文進行批判性思考，檢視其假設及方法，並反思新的可能性
3.	能在課堂中清晰地表達自己的觀點，並與持不同觀點者進行理性的討論
課程要求
課堂參與 15%
所有修課同學須閱讀指定閱讀文獻，並提出至少1個討論問題，於課堂開始前24小時上傳至NTU COOL平台討論區。本課程亦鼓勵同學定期關注相關新聞時事，並於課堂正式討論開始前與全班分享。課堂進行時，所有修課同學須參與討論。修課同學可以email跟授課教師請假。若因特殊健康理由而缺席，須提供書面醫療證明。無故缺席將喪失參與分數。
課堂報告15%
每週由修課同學中產生引導討論組。引導討論組須針對當週指定閱讀文獻製作書面摘要（單行間距，不超過3頁）及投影片（不超過10頁），書面摘要及投影片內容包括：（1）摘要文章內容及主要貢獻、（2）對文章論點及方法的批評、（3）對每篇文章提出至少2個討論議題。書面摘要及投影片須於課堂開始前24小時上傳至NTU COOL平台討論區。引導討論組的同學若臨時請假，須改加入其他週的引導討論組。

選項（一）：針對永續金融與ESG利害相關人，進行一次的田野調查或訪談，紀錄字數約3000字。選項（二）：針對課程相關主題，撰寫批判性的文獻回顧，字數約3000字。

核心能力關聯

為確保您我的權利,請尊重智慧財產權及不得非法影印
課程概述
本課程將探討生態系統功能的科學基礎以及生態系統服務的經濟價值。生態系統功能(ecosystem functioning)是指生態系統內部發生的生物、地球化學和物理過程及組成部分，例如初級生產、養分循環、分解和能量流動。生態系統服務(ecosystem services)代表人類可以從自然生態系統能取得的所有資源，例如糧食生產、氣候調節和休閒機會。
課程前半部分將從自然科學的角度關注生物多樣性與生態系統功能之間的關係。這種關係根植於群落生態學，強調物種相互作用和共存；以及生態系統生態學，研究生物群落對其周圍環境的影響。透過研究生物多樣性與生態系統功能的關係，學生將對物種間相互作用及其對生態系統的影響有完整的了解。
課程後半部分將深入探討生態系統服務的概念，有時也被稱為地球的自然資本(natural capital)。這些服務包括直接提供食品、木材和淡水等商品；調節服務，如氣候調節或害蟲控制；文化服務，如娛樂和旅遊。生態系統擁有自然資本的概念在過去十年中日益受到重視，因為科學家、經濟學家和政治家認識到需要考慮傳統經濟市場未包括的生態系統價值。本課程將探討用於測量和將生態系統服務與基本生態過程聯繫起來的方法，這些服務的價值評估和貨幣化方式，以及公部門及私部門為管理這些服務而實施的計劃。
課程目標
期望學生能獲得以下能力：
(1) 正確描述生物多樣性與生態系統功能之關係，並能解釋此關係之機制
(2) 正確描述生態系統服務概念，並能簡述生物多樣性對生態系統服務的影響
(3) 正確描述評估生態系統服務的概念，並能判別與應用各評估方法
課程要求
Basic understanding of ecology. Mastery of community ecology is recommended.

課程大綱
為確保您我的權利,請尊重智慧財產權及不得非法影印
課程概述
生態設計為整合生命歷程，降低環境破壞衝擊的設計形式；是一種調適並整合自然過程的有效方式。整合意味著設計能尊重物種多樣性、降低資源耗損、保存養份與水循環、維護棲息地品質，並關注人類與生態系健全的所有其他先決條件。因應氣候變遷對生態環境與人類生活之衝擊，此課程以生態導向思維出發，從宏觀到微分別論述三個單元主題：生態環境規劃、活動導入企劃、生態空間設計/生態產品設計。另外，透過各個單元主題之議題探討與實作操演，培養學生具備生態導向之規劃設計專業能力。
課程目標
單元一：生態環境規劃（洪詩涵 老師）
1.生態城市、環境規劃：生態系統、人類健康、環境議題
2.生態環境指標：植群多樣性、城市棲地指認、環境感知、接觸頻率
3.生態環境規劃：環境疊圖分析、改善計畫
4.生態環境規劃案例
單元二：活動導入企劃（陳惠美 老師）
1.生態活動的市場與需求：發展趨勢議題、目標市場、遊憩體驗與需求
2.生態活動的資源與創意：動物、植物、氣候、水文、地質地形、景觀等。
3.生態活動企劃與設計：活動主題、活動內容、遊程安排、成本效益、策略聯盟。
4.生態活動設計與入企劃案例：環境教育、食農教育、日常遊憩、觀光旅遊、主體節慶。

課程概述
※上課地點更動為博雅205、206教室※
每一個人都是一個生命的奧秘，因緣際會地來到世界上，有著各自不同而獨特的主客觀條件，並一步一步地展開生命的旅程。在這個旅程中我們雖然已累積了不少的生命經驗，不過，要如何將這些經驗焠練出生命的智慧，引導我們開創未來更精彩的人生，需要我們停下腳步來，好好地檢視自己，建構自己的生命敘事，一如德爾菲阿波羅神廟的箴言所指出的「認識你自己」（γνῶθι σεαυτόν）。由於人是一種關係性的存有，在自我認識的過程，以友朋為鏡，彼此參照，是不可或缺的一種相互學習。本課程希望透過在課堂中創造說故事與聽故事的人文空間，讓同學可以進入彼此的生命，從他人故事的獨特與引發共鳴的相互激盪中，釐清自身的生命經驗，整理出屬於自己的生命敘事，並在相互支持中，開創出屬於自己未來更豐富的生命故事。
依此，「透過故事讓彼此分享生命」是這堂生命教育課想要營造的空間。每一個獨特的生命故事都是一種「禮物」，也是生命教育的教科書。
本課程透過三重設計讓同學進入他人與自己的生命中：
一、 邀請有著豐富生命故事的教授或社會人士來到課堂上分享，課後再由同學寫信給每位講者作為「回禮」，告訴講者他的故事帶來的感動。
二、 每位講者課後會與同學們聚餐，每位同學一學期有一次機會選擇一位講者共進晚餐，進行近距離的接觸。
三、 課程中期，同學開始進行分組，進行數次的小組生命故事分享，生命故事分享小組的目標是希望培養同學之間彼此聆聽與回應故事的能力，並藉由彼此相近的社會位置學習以故事召喚故事的集體動力。
小組由授課老師們分別帶領成為生命敘事分享團體。期末報告要求每一位同學以用數位影像敘事的方式說出屬於自己的生命故事，完成名為「給現在的自己一份禮物」的期末報告。
課程目標
1. 培養同學聽故事與寫故事的能力，並學習透過書寫故事的方式陪伴自己未來的生命。
2. 理解與接納他者生命經驗的人文素養。
3. 學習敘事能力與聆聽素養。
課程要求
修課同學要準時出席課程，聆聽受邀者的生命故事分享，並於課後書寫一封信給講者；
同學在第一堂課必須選擇出席一次在講者課堂分享後於學校附近舉行的晚餐聚會；
接著，會請同學在課堂中口述分享自己的生命故事，並於期中報告將自己的生命故事文字化；
期末報告則請每位同學以5至10分鐘的數位敘事影像呈現自己的生命故事之美。

課程概述
Generated by ChapGPT:
This course explores the use of ChatGPT, a large language model, as a tool for engaging with philosophical questions and problems. Students will learn how to interact with ChatGPT to generate responses to philosophical questions. The course will cover a range of topics in philosophy of time.
In this course, students will learn how to formulate questions that can be answered by ChatGPT, how to interpret ChatGPT's responses, and how to critically evaluate the limitations and strengths of using machine learning for philosophical inquiry.
Overall, this course aims to develop students' critical thinking and analytical skills by providing them with a unique opportunity to engage with philosophical questions using cutting-edge technology.
Notes:
Below are the philosophical questions we will go through in this course.  Do the past or future exist in the way the present exists? Are pastness, presentness, and futurity consistent notions? Do I have temporal parts as well as spatial parts if time is in many ways analogous to space? How can we mention the past if it’s already gone? How can we know this is the present moment? On the reunion of twins after a space journey, which one is older? Is time travel possible? Is it possible to kill one’s grandfather? Is presentness compatible with special relativity given that the latter allows no absolute simultaneity? Does space exist like a substance in its own right, or is it nothing but spatial relationships between objects?
課程目標
The goal of this course is to equip students with the following abilities:
(a)	To understand the philosophical works and how philosophers ask questions.
(b)	To analyze and critically evaluate these philosophical viewpoints with the aid of ChatGPT.
(c)	To develop and articulate your own views on the issues.
課程要求
Course dynamics:
Each student enrolled in this class is expected to adhere to certain requirements. These include completing assigned readings before every class, attending each session, and participating actively in both in-class and group discussions.
The class will be divided into sets, with each set comprising five groups. Each group, in turn, will have only four members.
In the first session of class, each group will use ChatGPT to learn as much as possible about a given topic. This will involve a series of tasks, such as checking ChatGPT's response to the topic, refining questions to obtain more refined answers, critically evaluating ChatGPT's responses, and formulating the group's response, which should differ from ChatGPT's response.
In the second session of class, 2 or 3 randomly selected groups will present to the class, showcasing their interaction with ChatGPT and detailing the tasks they completed in the first session of class. The instructor will evaluate each group's performance and grant an additional point towards the final grade, which may be a positive or negative number.
In the third session of class, the instructor will provide a traditional lecture-style overview of the topic and views.
In addition, there will be four group presentation events, with each set organizing a time and place for their presentation and debate. (So different sets may have different time/place for presentation.) Each group will be required to present their findings (just like what they do in the first session of class) and answer questions or challenges from other groups. Presentations have to be filmed and uploaded to NTUCOOL as proof of completion.

課程概述
This course draws on global marketing/business contexts to introduce students to the theory and practical application of negotiations with an emphasis on skill development. This is a highly relevant subject for students who are interested in learning how to achieve goals through negotiation. Whether you are negotiating your services to a company during a job interview, selecting a supplier for your retail shop, or deciding on a restaurant to eat lunch with your classmates, your negotiation skills will help you get what you want.
Negotiation can be taught and improved with experience. The theory of negotiation is covered in this class. However, the ability to negotiate is not easily transmitted through textbooks and listening to lectures. Thus, the key value of this course is the use of a simulation platform to develop and practice real negotiation skills. Based on role-playing-game format (RPG), students put theory into use.
After taking this course, students will understand the fundamentals of negotiation in global marketing and business contexts, as well as develop practical negotiation skills. Specific content includes negotiation and marketing terminology, generic negotiation strategies and tactics, and the effects of psychological and cultural factors.
This course is composed of three integrated components: lectures of the core concepts, group research presentations of specific timely issues, and the group-based simulations. Each component is integrated with the other to provide feedback and learning experiences that go beyond traditional lecture-style classroom teaching methodologies.
課程目標
Lectures
The instructor-led lectures introduce core concepts and the role of negotiations in business and marketing. Lectures are given in the first half-dozen meetings. These provide students with the theoretical foundations of negotiation and related issues. Lectures may be supplemented with some short participation/discussion activities.
Research presentations
Each group will do one research presentation on a specific negotiation topic. In this short presentation, you should introduce your topic and how its effects on negotiations. You can illustrate this with examples to better express your message. You can be creative in this presentation if you wish ( e.g., role play or make an instructional video). The content should be based on real findings (need to do some basic research on the topic using respectable sources such as textbooks and academic articles). The goal is to report what effects this subject has on negotiations and how to leverage it for your benefit, or reduce its negative consequences if the issues can be a detriment to effective negotiation.
Presentations will be done at the beginning of class (see schedule) before the RPG round begins. Groups that are attending class online should submit a video presentation, which will be played in front of the class during the scheduled presentation.
The topic is chosen by your group.
Quizzes
Online quizzes will be assigned on a schedule (see course schedule). The content of the quizzes is directly from the coursebook. You will need the book to answer the questions correctly. There are 7 quizzes in total. Your grade is the average of the best 6 of these quizzes. In other words, your poorest quiz score will be dropped from the calculation. Choose this option if you want to focus on vocabulary and concepts.
Simulations
This component of class consists of in-person and/or simulations in the form of a role-playing-game (RPG). Each group takes on the role of a company (buyer or seller). Each group has to make deals with other groups negotiating the price, quality, production and purchase volumes of the product, which is changed each round. These negotiations are informed by the lecture and presentation topics and are combined with the learning by doing methodology of the simulations.
Simulations take place in the classroom and/or online. Each round is open for about 5 days, allowing groups to make deals outside of class time. After agreeing to the terms of a deal, both groups must submit matching deal forms through the web application’s online Deal Report. The simulation software automatically calculates the deal results and populates the groups’ scoresheet with points. Each deal generates different points for the buyer and seller. More points are awarded to groups that have done a better job at negotiating to their advantage. For example, buyer groups earn a greater number of points for deals that have purchase prices that are much lower than their price ceiling. All negotiable variables and several additional factors (such as number of partners the group completes deals with during a negotiation round) have an effect on the score.
This means students need to be motivated and actively seek trading partners in class and/or online. At the end of each round, groups are ranked by score. Each new round starts fresh. The group with the best overall rank over all the rounds of simulations receives the top score for this component and then other groups' scores follow according to relative rank.
*Details and examples of the negotiation simulations will be provided in class, and one whole class is dedicated to a trial run of the simulation. “Learning by doing” is the best method for becoming acquainted with the system and for negotiations in general.
課程要求
The weighting of the course score is as follows:
Classroom Performance(I):35%
Presentation:15%
Negotiation simulations(II) & closure report(III):50%
I Classroom performance includes 1) attendance 10%, 2) quizzes 15%, and 3) semester group evaluation 10%.
II I Negotiation simulations can be done at any time within the assigned period, but each
simulation must be completed with all deal information reported online before the
deadline. Final simulation grades are calculated relative to the performance of the other
groups. 40%
III Each student must individually complete a closure report. 10%

課程大綱

課程概述
傳統福利國家能透過制度與政策工具「管治」市場，但是在經濟與金融全球化的環境下，國家卻失去駕馭市場機能的能力，同時損失據以維繫大眾忠誠、保障公民福利權的資源。由於下列三個因素的影響，福利國家賴以維繫的財政基礎受到嚴重侵蝕：資本市場全球化、經濟生產國際化、勞動市場彈性化。面對此一國際經濟分工秩序的重組，到底各工業民主國家如何因應？福利國家的去管治化真是因應經濟全球化所不得不採取的策略？或是新保守主義與新自由主義政治策略的成功使然？全球化對於東亞乃至台灣正茁生中的福利部門具有什麼意涵？此外，全球化也促成一個在全球層次的全球社會政策（global social policy）興起，主要探討包括重要國際組織在內的行動者，在全球各地倡議特定的社會政策理念，並積極為各國政府提供福利改革的藥方，形成鮮明的社會政策學習與擴散的現象。近年來一些新興的全球化現象諸如疫情危機、數位經濟等議題，也觸及到社會治理以及社會政策的議題，必須思考如何在全球層面及在地層次處理日益複雜的社會問題。奠基於民族國家界限的福利政治，逐漸受到全球與區域治理力量的影響，出現跨越國界的政策社群，影響著各國福利改革的內涵。這些面向的問題都是我們瞭解當代社會福利發展的重要主軸。

待補。

課程概述
In this course, students will learn the role of branding strategy in marketing. A brand is not simply serving as a name for recognition, but can be utilize as an effective tool to derive values for firms and consumers. The course aims to provide students with insights into how different branding strategies can be executed to attain desirable strategic outcomes.
Topic will cover brands and brand management, customer-based brand equity and brand positioning, brand resonance and the brand value chain, choosing elements to build brand equity, designing marketing programs to build brand equity, integrating marketing communications to build brand equity, branding in the digital era, developing a brand equity measurement and management system, measuring sources of brand equity: capturing customer mind-set, measuring outcomes of brand equity: capturing market performance, designing and implementing brand architecture strategies, introducing and naming new products and brand extensions, managing brands over time, and managing brands over geographical boundaries and market segments.
課程目標
1.	Introduce the key issues in building, measuring, and managing brands and brand equity,
2.	Understand the important role of brand equity for developing competitive advantages by blending with marketing mix strategies.
3.	Learn the process of measuring brand strength and brand equity.
4.	Conduct group project relating to brand development, brand positioning, strategic brand management, branding strategies with marketing communication to achieve brand management goals.

課程簡介影片
核心能力關聯

課程大綱
為確保您我的權利,請尊重智慧財產權及不得非法影印
課程概述
為鼓勵臺大學生走出自己的象牙塔，對國際、洲際的動態與火熱的議題賦予關心與了解，加強理論與實務的結合，培養正確的國際觀與全球意識，本校共同教育中心將開設「全球講座-認識全球」課程，加廣加深學生對全球各大洲各角落的認知。在儘量涵蓋全球主要區域與國家的前提下，授課內容聚焦於主要國家和區域的內部及對外之經濟、政治、安全議題，其他諸如文化、醫療、環保、科技、金融等問題，亦有可能觸及。 本(113-1)學期開設之「全球通識講座-認識全球」，將聘請我國已往曾經駐外之政務官員為主，學者專家為輔，擔任講座。各週授課內容上將強調連貫性與統整性，以及力求授課內容同時兼顧資訊性和學術性、理論性。為期與授課內容相互銜接，每二至三週一次的綜合討論，將涵蓋以下的一個或數個討論主軸，成為貫穿全學期課程的整體性架構： (一) 該地區或該國家本身之經濟發展情況、主要產業型態、經濟政策的特色、較有特色或知名度的企業(家)，以及其本身之歷史發展主軸和文化特色。 (二) 該地區或該國家近年來在區域性 and/or全球性經貿整合(例如：FTA)當中的成就、角色，或面臨的挑戰或瓶頸；未來在對外經貿整合上的新作法；與我國的經貿關係。 (三) 近年來該地區或該國家的內部政治發展、政治體制的特色、對外的政  治、經濟、軍事安全關係，包括與中華民國台灣的外交與軍事關係。 本課程每學期選擇數個主題規劃不同的講題，每一領域含二至三次講題，每次講座主講者為一人。另外，本課程在同一主題的講題結束之前規劃綜合討論，讓學生在二至三次講題內容之後，根據講者所提出的討論問題，先進行分組討論後，再和講者進行更深入的溝通交流。最後，本課程在邀請講者時，也將請演講者提供適當的閱讀材料，作為本課程的延伸閱讀，以加強修課者之相關知識深度與廣度。修課同學選擇延伸閱讀讀物，撰寫並繳交閱讀報告，將可獲得加分。
課程目標
鼓勵臺大學生對全球相關政經議題增加關心與了解，培養正確的價值觀與國際觀，提升未來競爭力，放眼全世界，並加強理論與實務的結合。
課程要求
出席：10% (每次上課均需簽到，請假不得超過三次。)
綜合討論：20% (每次綜合座談由講者提問，同學以小組形式參與討論，並提出該組結論。)
重點整理與心得報告：70% (每次演講各一篇心得，每篇至少600字，至多1200字。內容包含1.三個講座重點(60%); 2.個人心得(40%,內含感想20%及獨特創見20%)。於每次演講結束後上傳NTU COOL作業區，惟若上課老師有不同要求，則依老師之規定。)

課程概述
1、本課程討論刑法總則的各項概念，預計為一學年的課程，第一學期將討論刑法基本原理原則、犯罪三階層的各項要素（構成要件該當性、違法性、罪責），時間許可將一併討論未遂犯的部分重點。
2、預計第1-3周講述刑法基本原則與犯罪基礎定義，第4-7周講述構成要件該當性，講述完後舉行期中考
3、第8-10周講述違法性、第11-13周講述罪責、第14-15周則說明未遂犯基本概念，第16周期末考。
4、9/18（三）因教師公務延後至10:30上課，亦可能延後下課；11/20（三）因公務停課；具體補課時間將於課程中公布。
5、選修結果確定後，有意加選的同學請直接於第一次上課時至課堂，屆時會視課程負擔、教室容量及授課品質等實際情況決定加簽人數，並給予授權碼，若人數過多將抽籤處理。
課程目標
本課程之目的，是使學生能了解刑法總則有關犯罪成立之各項基本原理原則，課程教學主軸，不僅期望學生能夠習慣刑法高度抽象與邏輯性的犯罪審查過程，還必須深切地體悟刑罰施與是一種高度的國家強制行為，在個案犯罪刑事責任的判定過程中，必須嚴守最後手段性與罪刑法定主義的基本要求，以求將刑罰的施用範疇壓抑至最低，以期學生於在學期間，培養我國刑法犯罪成立與刑罰制度的基礎觀念，甚至養成足夠的批判能力，對我國現行刑法理論與立法動向進行反省式的思考，而將來進入實務工作後，也能夠謹慎地運用刑法的論理與解釋方法，將刑罰的效力有效地限制。
課程要求
1、理解刑事制裁施用上的最後手段屬性，掌握犯罪成立的可罰界限
2、知悉犯罪成立的判斷及審查步驟，及個別審查階層的具體內容
3、了解刑事制裁發動的正當性及其相應限制

課程概述
憲法是國家對於社群基礎價值的承諾，以及確保這些價值得以實現的權力機制設計。因此，本課程的內容由下列部分所組成：一、憲法的意義與生命，二、自由、民主、法治的基本憲政秩序，三、人民基本權利的沿革與各種基本權利的具體內涵，四、為了實踐前項目的所為的水平和垂直分權設計。藉此為修課同學建立起整體而動態的憲法理解。
由於本課程是法律系學生最早接觸的課程之一，再加上憲法學本身並非純粹的抽象思維，毋寧是歷史經驗的產物，所以本課程將特別著重具體法學爭議，特別是我國司法院大法官解釋的案例分析，以訓練修課同學在政治爭議中察覺憲法議題並且熟習憲法分析的能力。
課程目標
1. 課前準備：修習本課程的同學應於每堂課前預先研讀指定資料（課綱網址：https://ogy.de/vd97）。
※由於本學期上課週數縮減，課綱內容順序與授課進度有所出入，請以每週授課進度為準。
2. 課程參與：本課程依據上課主題設計出10個憲法爭議案例，自願參與分組報告的修課學生，將在課程助教的指導下撰寫書面報告，並搭配上課進度在課堂上進行15分鐘的口頭報告。
（課程參與額外加計10%，在開學第二周確定加退選人選後即會進行分組。）
3. 學期測驗：本課程會在期中和期末各舉行一次書面測驗。
4. 課程輔導：課程助教會在期初、期中、期末各提供一次上課內容的補充輔導。

課程大綱
為確保您我的權利,請尊重智慧財產權及不得非法影印
課程概述
憲法，一方面既是國家的根本大法，也是人民權利的保障。在法律的學習，更是最根本也是最受用的一個科目。將憲法學好學對，是法律學習的重要基礎。
當代憲政主義從18世紀萌芽，到了21世紀的今天，發展已臻成熟。全世界目前超過三分之二以上的國家，擁有合乎當代憲政主義的民主憲法與實際運作。台灣也不例外。這門課希望透過對憲法基本原理、憲法條文、憲法實踐以及憲法解釋的探討，讓同學對於當代憲政主義以及我國憲法的規範與實踐，都有清楚的理解以及進一步分析批判的能力。
在課程設計上，這門課是以憲法基本原理與條文為骨幹，憲法實踐–尤其是司法院大法官的憲法解釋為血肉，來進行關於憲法的討論。這門課所指定的教科書，尤其注重對於憲法案例的討論與分析，希望在增進同學對於憲法規範瞭解的同時，也能對於憲法實際運作有清楚認識。
課程目標
本課程已經有非常好的案例教科書作為上課的基礎。同學對於指定教材的事先閱讀，以及上課時對於相關案例的發言討論，是這門課最基本的上課態度與條件。學期初，會先將同學進行分組，授課教師會以組為單位，隨堂要求同學發言。這門課將有期中考與期末考，考試皆為open book，考試不在測驗同學的背誦能力，而是希望看出同學理解的深度以及獨立思考的批判能力。

課程概述
本課程的任務，是建立對於刑法總則基本觀念的理解，大致包含三個面向：個別抽象概念超出文字意義上的深層掌握、概念於整個背景理論體系中的定位，以及抽象概念與具體事實之間的對應關係。因此本課程的重點，不在於對眾多歧異的學說和實務見解的整理和傳遞，而主要是培養獨立運用理論解決具體案例問題的一般能力。
刑法總則（一）
一、刑法基本概念 （第1-3週）
1. 刑法的意義
2. 刑法的效力
3. 刑罰的概念──應報或預防？
4. 刑法的作用──法益概念的意義與功能
5. 犯罪概念與類型概說
6. 刑法上行為概念
二、不法理論──以故意作為犯為中心 （第4-10週）
1. 不法的意義──形式不法與實質不法的區分
2. 構成要件該當性
(1) 客觀不法要件
a. 行為不法與結果不法
b. 因果關係與客觀歸責
(2) 主觀不法要件
a. 故意概念
b. 構成要件錯誤與主觀歸責
3. 違法性 （第11-14週）
(1) 違法性概念
(2) 阻卻違法事由
a. 正當防衛──兼論誤想正當防衛
b. 緊急避難
c. 依法令之行為
d. 公務員服從命令之行為
e. 被害人同意或承諾
三、有責性以及其他犯罪成立要件 （第15-17週）
1. 責任概念
2. 阻卻責任事由
(1) 欠缺責任能力──兼論原因自由行為
(2) 欠缺不法意識
3. 減免責任事由
(1) 減免之法理
(2) 減免責任之緊急避難
(3) 防衛過當
4. 客觀可罰性要件
課程目標
建立同學對於刑法總則的基本認識與運用能力。

課程概述
本課程的任務，是建立修課同學對於刑法基本觀念的理解。刑法包括犯罪論及（刑罰等）刑事制裁論兩大部分，犯罪論就是去探討犯罪是什麼，以及犯罪成立及不成立的各種條件，而刑事制裁論則是處理違犯刑事法規後，應賦予何種制裁以及其程度。刑法總則授課的比重集中在前者（犯罪論），但掌握前者的關鍵卻在於對後者的批判性理解。
在當前凡事都講究速效，刑罰成為維繫社會運作最琅琅上口、最廉價（但也最昂貴）手段的時代下，身為一位將來可能手執刑罰之鞭的法律系學生，必須要有一個不受社會輿論干擾、獨立自主思考犯罪與刑罰問題的空間，本課程希望能夠提供這樣的空間，讓修課同學勇於嘗試有別於社會主流的思考模式。除了思考能力的鍛鍊之外，本課程會依章節介紹目前法解釋的實務現況，並且提出批判。授課教師本身當然有一定的學說主張以及理論傾向，同時，教材編排內容也會以結果反價值論（或客觀主義理論）為基底，與國內常見的目的行為論或二元行為反價值論等架構不同，不過，課程中會先講解通說內容，然後才會進行進一步的問題引導與分析，讓各位同學有思辨的機會。當然，本課程的重點，不在於對眾多歧異的學說見解的整理和傳遞，而主要是培養獨立運用理論解決具體案例問題的一般能力，因此，僅於必要範圍內介紹各家學說。
修課同學的聽講重點不在於習得授課教師的見解為何，而在於認真思考這些在課堂中拋出來的問題，並且透過自己的力量，找尋出滿意的答案。因此，最終評價的重點並不在於寫了多少老師的見解，而在於能否從事實敘述中，發現可疑的問題（具備問題意識），並且試圖思考各種解答的可能性。
其他內容請參閱：
https://reurl.cc/NR1LM5
課程目標
1. 刑法總則的基本認識與運用能力。
2. 讓修課同學更清楚知道台灣刑事制度的過去及現在，然後展望未來。
3. 培養具有刑事學思維的法律人，從刑事學的角度思考刑事法的侷限以及制度背後所可能潛藏的後續效應。
4. 將刑罰謙抑性原則從空洞的口號轉化為富有刑事學觀點的實踐脈絡。
課程要求
1. 上課並不限於教師單向的講解，希望能與同學互動討論，一方面刺激思考，另一方面可以確認同學對課程內容的了解程度。因此希望同學能夠踴躍發言。
2. 不過，本課程沒有任何翻轉教室/式的設計，因為，要顛覆的從來就不是教室或教學方式，而是學生腦中的思維。學生積極的課前、課中、課後參與，並不是顛覆腦中思維的必要條件，也不是充分條件。退一步言，上課只是開啟新思緒的誘發手段之一，來上課不一定會有新思緒，不來上課也不代表思緒就無法誘發。因此，教師並不會點名或以出席率決定成績，出席率高在評分上的優勢可能只有當成績不理想時以平日參與程度作為酌加分數的依據而已。
3. 上課時鼓勵使用各式電子產品，唯請勿發出聲音干擾他人。
4. 禁止錄影。在課程使用目的的範圍內，可以錄音及照相。
5. 評分：期末考(90%)、課堂表現(10％)

課程概述
地理資訊系統（GEOGRAPHICAL INFORMATION SYSTEM, GIS）是一種利用電腦科技來輔助地理資料的輸入、儲存、檢索、分析和展示的資訊系統。GIS 不僅僅是一個獨立的研究領域，而且是資訊處理和其他使用空間分析技術專業領域之間的共同基礎。這門課程提供了有關GIS的基本概念、原則和實際技能的介紹。學生將學習如何收集、管理、分析和視覺化空間數據以解決現實世界的問題，並將透過文獻討論與專題計畫了解GIS的學術應用。
課程目標
在課程結束時，學生應該能夠：
1. 瞭解地理資訊系統的核心原則。
2. 收集、整理和管理空間數據。
3. 使用GIS工具和技巧分析空間數據。

6. 展示在GIS軟體（ArcGIS）方面的熟練技能。
7. 設計並實施涉及空間數據的原創研究計畫。

課程概述
本課程為地質科學系四年級必修課程，內容闡述地質資源的基本概念、基礎理論以及形成條件，分析各種礦產成因的地質特徵及其控礦因素。同時根據近代地質學的發展，介紹成礦物質的來源、成礦模式、成礦系列和礦床時空分佈及與地體構造之關係等觀念。本課程分為上下兩個單元─第一單元涵蓋以火成、岩漿熱液、非岩漿熱液為主的礦床，以及在全球地體構造中礦床綜論，此外還包括礦物原料、相關材料科學及其主要應用；目的在於介紹學生認識以火成作用為主的各類型礦床，以及目前實際應用的主要礦物原料與文明工業發展的關係等。第二單元涵蓋沈積與地表作用形成的礦床，並特別加強石油及天然氣資源探勘的基本概念；目的在於協助學生認識地質學在油氣探勘之應用，課程著重於油氣系統的地質特性及探勘科技。
課程目標
本課程以教導學生具備基礎地質資源知識為目標，尤其著重在各類礦床之地質成礦過程與作用。主要內容包括：
1. 地質資源簡介
2. 火成成礦作用
3. 岩漿熱液成礦作用
4. 熱液成礦作用
5. 表生與沈積成礦作用
6. 煤與石油地質基礎原理
7. 石油系統與非傳統能源
8. 表生與沈積礦床案例
9. 石油盆地與油藏分析
10. 石油探勘與發現案例
11. 煤與非傳統能源之探勘案例
12. 全球地體構造下的礦床
13. 能源與環境
14. 資源回收保育與未來資源
課程要求
本課程為地質科學系四年級必修課程，也是大學部的統整課程之一，修課同學應具備基礎地質專業知識，最好是修畢地質系前三年的必修課。

課程概述
This course aims to provide training and experience of field geological survey for undergraduate students, mostly for students in their junior year.  We plan to focus on topics that are related to some major geological hazards, such as tectonic movement and landslide.  The actual field area will be determined on the basis of the specific topic chosen.  Studente with a previous experience of Geological Surveying (II) are preferred, but not required.  The students are expected to join the field survey, work with the professor on the specific research topic in the field, and finish a written report of the field work.  The grades will be determined by the participation of the student in the field and the content of the report.

課程概述
註 : 胡植慶老師授課之地質調查導論一05班為獨立授課，上課時間與01~04班完全不同，修課同學還請留意05班公告。
註 : 因蘇花路況不穩定因素，行程有可能會變動，若有變動會在第一時間通知。
本課程係以非地質科學系本校學生為授課對象，為全校性之選修課程。於學期中出發到野外考察，前往臺灣東北海岸、海岸山脈和花東縱谷及中央山脈進行地質探索，認識臺灣的地質環境與各種地質現象。
課程採取集中上課方式，不排定課表（修課者需自行評估並承擔授課時間與其他課程時間重疊的影響）。野外前，先集中於單日(共6小時)進行室內講學，介紹考察路線地質概況、相關基礎知識與野外安全事項，而於野外地質考察行程中，除實地觀察外，佐以學習單以整合知識並鼓勵學生進行綜合討論。
將藉由野外對地質現象的親身觀察，結合對臺灣地體構造的認識，以瞭解臺灣不同構造區塊的地質特性和演育歷史，並期進一步讓學生關懷及重視臺灣的地質環境。
113-1課程時間:
行前課時間: 2024/09/21(六)
野外課程時間: 2024/10/4(五) - 2024/10/7(一)
＊ 行前課與野外所有行程都必須「全程參與」才能獲得學分，請留意時間允許才修習本課程！
初選報到時間: 09/01(日) - 09/04(三) 23：59(各班助教寄信通知)，逾期視同放棄
加簽候補網路登記: 即日起 - 09/04(三) 23：59 (開學前見FB及地質系網頁公告)
現場加簽時間: 09/09(一) 18:30 地質系地下中庭大講堂
＊ 行前課程：
時間：09 月 21 日(星期六)，8:50~17:00
地點：待定(會於09/21前通知)
內容：
1. 課程與行程簡介
2. 臺灣的地體構造概論與東部斷層活動
3. 岩石礦物巡禮
4. 臺灣常見的沉積岩與沉積構造
5. 臺灣的變質岩和變質構造
6. 行前安全講習
＊ 期中考將會在行前課當天於課程結束後舉行。
＊ 四天三夜的野外行程暫定如下: (確切的行程會在行前課公告)
第一天，東北海岸：
(1) 陰陽海：介紹陰陽海成因，觀察實體化石、生痕化石和節理系的成因。
(2) 梗枋火成岩岩脈：介紹龜山島及活火山作用，觀察火成岩脈和硬頁岩的關係和低度變質岩的鉛筆狀構造。
(3) 東澳粉鳥林：介紹變質作用及變質構造，教導學生辨認角閃岩。
(4) 朝陽漁港 : 介紹變質作用及變質構造，教導學生辨認片岩。
夜宿花蓮。
第二天，花東海岸：
(1) 二十號橋砂岩岩脈：介紹海岸山脈地層名稱及構造演化史，觀察及解釋砂岩岩脈成因。
(2) 石門柱狀玄武岩：介紹奇美火成雜岩及火山噴發史，觀察岩漿冷凝形成的柱狀解理。
(3) 三仙台：介紹斑狀安山岩和浮石成因，觀察及尋找玉髓。
(4) 石梯坪：介紹海階成因、定年方法和火山噴發產物和相關構造，觀察不同海階面、壺穴、火山灰和火山碎屑之沉積產狀、單面山。
(5) 小野柳：介紹判定岩層上下關係之沉積構造，觀察波痕、交錯層和脫水構造。
夜宿臺東(知本)。
第三天，花東縱谷：
(1) 利吉地質公園：介紹海溝產物利吉混同層的成因和海洋地殼蛇綠岩套，觀察泥岩中的剪切構造和大小不一的外來岩塊。
(2) 鹿野高台：介紹鹿野高台、龍田階地、鹿野溪、鹿野斷層、卑南溪間的相互作用關係。
(3) 池上大坡國小：介紹 1951 年花東地震系列、地表變形觀測儀器和池上斷層潛移特性，觀察潛移活動對大坡國小人造建物如溜滑梯和擋土牆的破壞情形。
(4) 瑞穗瑞北溪尋寶：介紹變質岩相及片岩中常見的礦物組合。學生於瑞北溪谷中搜尋辨別石榴子石、陽起石和藍閃石片岩(竹葉石)。
夜宿花蓮。
第四天：
(1) 嶺頂 : 介紹火成岩、0403地震同震抬升作用。
(2) 花蓮七星潭：介紹1951年花東地震系列、觀察地震所形成的海階。
返回臺北。
課程目標
本課程主要目的希望透過野外考察讓學生瞭解臺灣活動造山帶的各種有趣的地質現象，激發學生珍視臺灣這個天然的地質實驗室。

課程概述
本課程屬於國文課程中的「文化思想與寫作」領域，主題為「自我與他者」，以《史記》選篇為主。主要探討歷史人物所呈現的人性、情感、思想等面向，並對應電影意象的延伸，從廣角的視野帶領同學透過不同的生命型態反思自我之立身價值。授課進度與期中考試日期會依照授課狀況彈性調整。
課程目標
1. 通過各種代表性文本的精讀、解析及詮釋，加強學生的人文思維與涵養。
2. 訓練學生分析與思辨的基本能力，培養轉化知識或經驗的論述和表達能力。
3. 藉由實作與討論，充實文類知識，使學生逐步掌握寫作要點。
課程要求
一、作業抄襲者，一律零分。
二、作業準時繳交，逾時不收。
三、上課準時出席（遲到十分鐘以上該節以曠課計），積極參與討論。
四、除與課堂相關，禁用筆電、手機、平板等3Ｃ產品。

課程大綱
為確保您我的權利,請尊重智慧財產權及不得非法影印
課程概述
本課程主題為「現代小說選讀」，將選讀魯迅、白先勇、奚淞、董啟章、賴香吟、駱以軍、曹麗娟、山本文緒等人的小說作品。這學期所選擇的文本幾乎都在小說中包含另一個作品，擬試由作品之間的互文性，重新發掘經典的意蘊與樂趣。
另一方面，語言文字能力也是課程重點，就理性面向，本課程將透過討論、報告與寫作練習，提升同學轉化經驗及知識的口語表達與論述能力；就感性面向，透過課堂上解析小說人物心理、敘事情節及結構，期待培養同學觀察、同理的敏銳度，更能理解自己與他人。
上課方式包含教師講授、課堂討論及分組報告。請同學於課前預先讀過指定文本，教師課堂導讀之後提出問題，以全班或小組討論的方式進行文本研讀，部分單元搭配分組報告。
第一學期的「大學國文一」原則上採取線上登記加選(第三類加選方式)，不開放授權碼。惟曾修習「大學國文二」，欲加選本課程者，請於第一週準時出席，至多加簽五名。
課程目標
1.藉由實作與討論，使學生能逐步掌握議論、說明、描寫、敘事或抒情等各種類型的寫作要點。
2. 訓練學生邏輯推理、議題分析的基本技能，能將知識或日常經驗清楚表達論述。
3. 通過各種代表性文本的精讀、解析及詮釋，加強學生的人文思維與涵養，並體會閱讀小說的無盡樂趣。
4. 以議題為導向，充實文體知識，使學生熟習各類文篇之主題類型、篇章結構與修辭方法。
課程要求
(一) 小說因篇幅緣故無法於課堂上逐句逐段講解，同學務必於每週上課前先行閱讀。
(二) 在討論過程中積極傾聽與表達，與其他同學分享經驗、交流想法。
(三) 準時上課、如期繳交作業。
(四) 勿讓手機等電子設備干擾自己與他人的學習。
(五)無故缺席一次扣總分2分，缺席5次以上，不得參加期末考。

2小時。

2.泰瑞‧伊格頓(Terry Eagleton)著、黃煜文譯：《如何閱讀文學》，臺北：商周，2014。

課程概述
本課程係以非地質科學系本校學生為授課對象，為全校性之選修課程。於學期中出發到野外考察，前往臺灣東北海岸、海岸山脈和花東縱谷及中央山脈進行地質探索，認識臺灣的地質環境與各種地質現象。
課程採取集中上課方式，不排定課表（修課者需自行評估並承擔授課時間與其他課程時間重疊的影響）。野外前，先集中於單日(共6小時)進行室內講學，介紹考察路線地質概況、相關基礎知識與野外安全事項，而於野外地質考察行程中，除實地觀察外，佐以學習單以整合知識並鼓勵學生進行綜合討論。
將藉由野外對地質現象的親身觀察，結合對臺灣地體構造的認識，以瞭解臺灣不同構造區塊的地質特性和演育歷史，並期進一步讓學生關懷及重視臺灣的地質環境。
113-1課程時間:
行前課時間: 2024/09/21(六)
野外課程時間: 2024/10/4(五) - 2024/10/7(一)
＊ 行前課與野外所有行程都必須「全程參與」才能獲得學分，請留意時間允許才修習本課程！
初選報到時間: 09/01(日) - 09/04(三) 23：59(各班助教寄信通知)，逾期視同放棄
加簽候補網路登記: 即日起 - 09/04(三) 23：59 (開學前見FB及地質系網頁公告)
現場加簽時間: 09/09(一) 18:30 地質系地下中庭大講堂
＊ 行前課程：
時間：09 月 21 日(星期六)，8:50~17:00
地點：待定(會於09/21前通知)
內容：
1. 課程與行程簡介
2. 臺灣的地體構造概論與東部斷層活動
3. 岩石礦物巡禮
4. 臺灣常見的沉積岩與沉積構造
5. 臺灣的變質岩和變質構造
6. 行前安全講習
＊ 期中考將會在行前課當天於課程結束後舉行。
＊ 四天三夜的野外行程暫定如下: (確切的行程會在行前課公告)
第一天，東北海岸：
(1) 陰陽海：介紹陰陽海成因，觀察實體化石、生痕化石和節理系的成因。
(2) 梗枋火成岩岩脈：介紹龜山島及活火山作用，觀察火成岩脈和硬頁岩的關係和低度變質岩的鉛筆狀構造。
(3) 東澳粉鳥林：介紹變質作用及變質構造，教導學生辨認角閃岩。
(4) 朝陽漁港 : 介紹變質作用及變質構造，教導學生辨認片岩。
夜宿花蓮。
第二天，花東海岸：
(1) 二十號橋砂岩岩脈：介紹海岸山脈地層名稱及構造演化史，觀察及解釋砂岩岩脈成因。
(2) 石門柱狀玄武岩：介紹奇美火成雜岩及火山噴發史，觀察岩漿冷凝形成的柱狀解理。
(3) 三仙台：介紹斑狀安山岩和浮石成因，觀察及尋找玉髓。
(4) 石梯坪：介紹海階成因、定年方法和火山噴發產物和相關構造，觀察不同海階面、壺穴、火山灰和火山碎屑之沉積產狀、單面山。
(5) 小野柳：介紹判定岩層上下關係之沉積構造，觀察波痕、交錯層和脫水構造。
夜宿臺東(知本)。
第三天，花東縱谷：
(1) 利吉地質公園：介紹海溝產物利吉混同層的成因和海洋地殼蛇綠岩套，觀察泥岩中的剪切構造和大小不一的外來岩塊。
(2) 鹿野高台：介紹鹿野高台、龍田階地、鹿野溪、鹿野斷層、卑南溪間的相互作用關係。
(3) 池上大坡國小：介紹 1951 年花東地震系列、地表變形觀測儀器和池上斷層潛移特性，觀察潛移活動對大坡國小人造建物如溜滑梯和擋土牆的破壞情形。
(4) 瑞穗瑞北溪尋寶：介紹變質岩相及片岩中常見的礦物組合。學生於瑞北溪谷中搜尋辨別石榴子石、陽起石和藍閃石片岩(竹葉石)。
夜宿花蓮。
第四天：
(1) 嶺頂 : 介紹火成岩、0403地震同震抬升作用。
(2) 花蓮七星潭：介紹1951年花東地震系列、觀察地震所形成的海階。
返回臺北。
課程目標
本課程主要目的希望透過野外考察讓學生瞭解臺灣活動造山帶的各種有趣的地質現象，激發學生珍視臺灣這個天然的地質實驗室。

課程概述
本課程乃針對非地質科系同學所設計，以恆春半島為主要調查區域，介紹野外地質調查的方法和經驗。因屬導論課程，故內容盡量淺顯，大致以國高中地球科學常識為基礎。教材以教師準備之講義為主，其內容包括野外地質調查的概念，以及恆春半島的地質簡介。未修過地質調查導論一的同學也可以選修。
本學期課程包括一次行前課堂講授、一次岩石公園實習，一次四天三夜的野外地質調查，以及學期考試。野外地質調查將在學期中舉行，為本課程的教學重點及成績評定的主要依據，凡不能參加野外行程的同學請不要選修。欲修習本課程同學請務必確認課程行事曆公告之各時間可否出席，為確認野外課程人數，請於學期初辦理報到並繳交野外費用定金後，才算完成選課。
本課程預定行程為，第一天前往恆春半島的路程中，參觀竹山槽溝保存園區。第二、三天及第四天上午往返踏勘恆春半島各觀察點，包括佳樂水、龍磐公園、石門、保力溪、三溝、萬里桐等地。第四天下午返回台北。
課程目標
讓同學在野外親身體驗的過程中，瞭解地質調查的意義，並且對台灣的地質特徵有基礎的認識。

課程概述
This course will cover the following topics in physics:
1. Mechanics
Review of Newtonian mechanics: F=ma, spring, momentum, angular momentum, energy, conservation, diffusion, Brownian motion, membrane transport, and ultrasound. Principle of least action. Noether's theorem.
2. Special and General Theory of Relativity
Length contraction, time-dilation, E=mc2, anti-matter and positron emission tomography (PET). Equivalence principle. Space-time curvature. 	Einstein field equation. Dirac equation.
3. Electricity and Magnetism
Classical electricity and mechanism. Defibrillator. Photodynamic therapy. Laser applications in biology and medicine.
4. Optics and Microscopy
Reflection, refraction, scattering, diffraction, Huygens-Fresnel Principle, total international reflection. Fiber optics. Structure of the eye. Bright field microscopy: applications to histology (hematoxylin and eosin/H&E imaging). Fluorescence microscopy: labelling of cellular organelles, antibody labeling, green fluorescent proteins. High throughput tissue cytometry and precision medicine.
5. Quantum mechanics
Wave-particle duality, Schrodinger equation, atomic structure. Molecular spectroscopy (absorption, emission, Raman) and applications. Spin, nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI). Quantum field theory.
課程目標
This course intends to provide the students with an introduction of the basic concepts in physics. Classical mechanics, statistical physics, electromagnetism, and modern physics (including quantum physics) will be covered. Whenever appropriate, I will discuss how physical concepts are linked to the development in biology and medicine.

課程概述
本課程係以非地質科學系本科學生為授課對象，為全校性之選修課程。利用學期中間，出發到野外考察，教授臺灣的各種地質現象。課程採集中上課方式，不排定課表，野外前在校內先集中上一次課（共6小時），介紹臺灣地質概論於野外地質考察行程中，並以學習單進行綜合討論。修課者需考量是否影響其他課程的上課時間，課程規劃及實際上課為臺灣東北海岸、海岸山脈和花東縱谷及中央山脈之地質探索。
本課程目標為藉著野外親身觀察不同的地質現象，結合臺灣地體構造，瞭解臺灣不同構造區塊的地質特性和演育的歷史，以期進一步讓學生關懷及重視臺灣的地質環境。

《四天三夜野外行程》
*** 因路況、天氣難以預估，確切行程將於行前課公告。
●第一天，東北海岸：
(1) 陰陽海：介紹陰陽海成因，觀察實體化石、生痕化石和節理系的成因。
(2) 梗枋火成岩岩脈：介紹龜山島及活火山作用，觀察火成岩脈和硬頁岩的關係和低度變質岩的鉛筆狀構造。
(3) 東澳粉鳥林：介紹變質作用及變質構造，教導學生辨認角閃岩。
(4) 花蓮七星潭：介紹1951年花東地震系列、觀察地震所形成的海階。
夜宿花蓮。
●第二天，花東海岸：
(1) 二十號橋砂岩岩脈：介紹海岸山脈地層名稱及構造演化史，觀察及解釋砂岩岩脈成因。
(2) 石門柱狀玄武岩：介紹奇美火成雜岩及火山噴發史，觀察岩漿冷凝形成的柱狀解理。
(3) 三仙台：介紹斑狀安山岩和浮石成因，觀察及尋找玉髓。
(4) 石梯坪：介紹海階成因、定年方法和火山噴發產物和相關構造，觀察不同海階面、壺穴、火山灰和火山碎屑之沉積產狀、單面山。
(5) 富岡地質公園：介紹判定岩層上下關係之沉積構造，觀察波痕、交錯層和脫水構造。
夜宿臺東。
●第三天，花東縱谷：
(1) 利吉地質公園：介紹海溝產物利吉混同層的成因和海洋地殼蛇綠岩套，觀察泥岩中的剪切構造和大小不一的外來岩塊。
(2) 池上大坡國小：介紹 1951 年花東地震系列、地表變形觀測儀器和池上斷層潛移特性，觀察潛移活動對大坡國小人造建物如溜滑梯和擋土牆的破壞情形。
(3) 池上地牛館：安朔葉教授紀念博物館。
(4) 瑞穗瑞北溪尋寶：介紹變質岩相及片岩中常見的礦物組合。學生於瑞北溪谷中搜尋辨別石榴子石、陽起石和藍閃石片岩（竹葉石）。
夜宿花蓮。
●第四天：
(1) 嶺頂沙丘：介紹嶺頂火成岩、花蓮溪口的地形變遷。
返回臺北。
課程目標
本課程主要目的希望透過野外考察讓學生瞭解臺灣活動造山帶的各種有趣的地質現象，激發學生珍視臺灣這個天然的地質實驗室。

課程概述
本課程乃針對非地質科系同學所設計，以恆春半島為主要調查區域，介紹野外地質調查的方法和經驗。因屬導論課程，故內容盡量淺顯，大致以國高中地球科學常識為基礎。教材以教師準備之講義為主，其內容包括野外地質調查的概念，以及恆春半島的地質簡介。未修過地質調查導論一的同學也可以選修。
本學期課程包括一次行前課堂講授、一次岩石公園實習，一次四天三夜的野外地質調查，以及學期考試。野外地質調查將在學期中舉行，為本課程的教學重點及成績評定的主要依據，凡不能參加野外行程的同學請不要選修。欲修習本課程同學請務必確認課程行事曆公告之各時間可否出席，為確認野外課程人數，請於學期初辦理報到並繳交野外費用定金後，才算完成選課。
本課程預定行程為，第一天前往恆春半島的路程中，參觀竹山槽溝保存園區。第二、三天及第四天上午往返踏勘恆春半島各觀察點，包括佳樂水、龍磐公園、石門、保力溪、三溝、萬里桐等地。第四天下午返回台北。
課程目標
讓同學在野外親身體驗的過程中，瞭解地質調查的意義，並且對台灣的地質特徵有基礎的認識。
課程要求

課程概述
本課程介紹有機農業的精神、操作管理技術、政策規範與驗證體系、以及全球趨勢，以講述、資料閱讀與查詢、或邀請專業人員分享說明的方式建立修課同學對有機農業的基礎認識，本課程一方面讓學生累積基礎知識，一方面請學生嘗試以有機的方法種植作物，課外參觀農場體驗，加入實作方法、工作坊討論與腦力激盪、蒐集有機農業科學文獻的新知與分享報告的活動，期望由在地思考並推展到更廣泛的有機農業範疇。
課程目標
1. 學生能指出機農業之精神、管理技術、農業系統中生物之影響與應用，政策規範、產品保障體系等專業知識，具備查詢有機農業相關資訊及延伸應用之能力。
2. 完成課程後能學生能夠區別有機農業和非有機作物生產體系的異同。
課程要求
1. 出席及參與課程
2. 完成期中考
3. 農場體驗課程作業：在第14週前課外時間進行農場參觀體驗一次，撰寫心得報告上傳並於課堂內分享
4. 專題報告：
(1)大學部學生：分組進行，本學期以Growing Organic Markets, Rooted in Organic Principles為主軸，閱讀相關資料嘗試連結發想或於週遭實踐，上傳繳交投影片成果並於課堂內分享。
(2)研究所學生：個人預先排定挑選一週次的主題，在當週或臨近週次進行10分鐘左右之內容報告，須上傳提供投影片。

課程概述
本課程乃針對非地質科系同學所設計，以恆春半島為主要調查區域，介紹野外地質調查的方法和經驗。因屬導論課程，故內容盡量淺顯，大致以國高中地球科學常識為基礎。教材以教師準備之講義為主，其內容包括野外地質調查的概念，以及恆春半島的地質簡介。未修過地質調查導論一的同學也可以選修。
本學期課程包括一次行前課堂講授、一次岩石公園實習，一次四天三夜的野外地質調查，以及學期考試。野外地質調查將在學期中舉行，為本課程的教學重點及成績評定的主要依據，凡不能參加野外行程的同學請不要選修。欲修習本課程同學請務必確認課程行事曆公告之各時間可否出席，為確認野外課程人數，請於學期初辦理報到並繳交野外費用定金後，才算完成選課。
本課程預定行程為，第一天前往恆春半島的路程中，參觀竹山槽溝保存園區或霧峰921地震園區。第二、三天及第四天上午往返踏勘恆春半島各觀察點，包括佳樂水、龍磐公園、石門、保力溪、三溝、萬里桐等地。第四天下午返回台北。
課程目標
讓同學在野外親身體驗的過程中，瞭解地質調查的意義，並且對台灣的地質特徵有基礎的認識。

課程概述
次世代定序的方法已廣泛應用在探討分子生物學上的分子機制，但數據龐大，必須使用的大數據分析方法，一般生物背景的研究生大都缺乏大數據分析的能力。此外，在探討分子生物學上的分子機制中，目前科學界，正加速開發各種新式的次世代定序備置方法已解決各式各樣的生物問題，例如：疾病遺傳學，表觀遺傳學，核糖核酸與蛋白質的交互作用，核糖核酸的結構與剪切，DNA變異等等的課題都可利用次世代定序的方式來研究。此課程目標以培養具備大數據資訊分析，使分子生物學背景的學生，能廣泛使用此方法，來解決分子生物性問題。
課程目標
1	培育具有大數據分析能力兼分子生物專業的人才
2	增進跨領域學習與交流
3	專業領域的增進與提升創新能力

課程大綱
為確保您我的權利,請尊重智慧財產權及不得非法影印
課程概述
Over the past three decades, the standard of living around the world has rapidly improved. From advanced Western countries to emerging industrialized nations in East Asia, millions of people have escaped poverty and now lead middle-class lives. Between 1981 and 2010, China alone lifted 680 million people out of poverty, reducing its poverty rate from 84% in 1980 to 10% in 2013 (The Economist, 2013). However, alongside this significant poverty reduction, the widening wealth gap (economic inequality) has gradually become a concern for scholars and political figures. Data reveals that since the 1980s, income inequality in Europe and the United States has steadily increased and continued to worsen (Piketty, 2014: 249). The expanding inequality has profound effects on society, ranging from public discontent with living conditions to preferences for redistributive policies. Politically, extreme wealth disparities can lead to revolutions and threaten the stability of governments. Undoubtedly, the widening wealth gap is a pressing issue in countries worldwide. Global leaders, including former U.S. President Obama and Pope Francis, recognize it as a serious global challenge. The COVID-19 pandemic, which began ravaging the world in 2020, has further exacerbated economic inequality. The purpose of this course is to understand the causes of inequality, explore its impact on social and political systems, and consider possible solutions.
課程目標
By the end of this course, students should be able to:
●	Students will gain a comprehensive understanding of economic inequality, its measurement, and various forms.
●	Students will critically analyze the theoretical and empirical literature on the causes and consequences of inequality.
●	Students will be able to evaluate policy proposals aimed at reducing inequality.
●	Students will develop strong research, communication, and critical thinking skills.
課程要求
Students are required to complete the following assignments.
Pre-class reading discussion	  10%
In-class discussion and participation	15%
Mid-term exam	25%
Group presentations	20%
Final term paper	30%

課程概述
這是一堂延續並深化過去所學之羽球基本技術與經驗建構的體育課；故需修課者於課餘安排至少一小時的羽球課外練習，以增加對技術更多的身體感悟並提升體適能，更期能因技術建構系統化而作為自身或社交休閒的健康活動!!!
整學期課程內容主要有:
一、羽球運動發展簡史、賽制、著名賽事、球場禮節
二、羽球運動的場地設備與器材
三、羽球單打基本技術、比賽簡要規則、裁判法
四、分組單打循環比賽、跨組挑戰賽
五、基本技術測驗。
六、每周至少一小時的課外羽球技能自我練習，以增加對羽球運動更多的身體感悟並期能作為自身或社交休閒的健康活動。
課程目標
一、了解羽球運動的知識與技能
二、培養羽球單打運動的基本常識與動作技能
三、鍛鍊健康體適能、享受運動樂趣
四、培養終身運動習慣與 運動社交技巧
五、增進羽球運動美感體驗
課程要求
一、 請準時上課，並在7 :30前吃過均衡早餐，且完成排毒動作，非誠勿試!
二、 上課須穿著能排/吸汗、貼身且利於伸展的運動服裝、球鞋 (勿穿襯衫和休閒褲)。
三、 請自備球拍、一筒練習羽球；每周須設法練習每周單元主題之羽球技術一小時，並可於下一周登記分
數，共10~12次。
四、 上課時可準備手機，利於自我練習時之動作錄影。
五、 遲到總比不到好! 無法到課者，請務必上網請假。若點名不到且未請假者以曠 課論。曠課則依學校規定
方式扣分；有證明之公假、喪假不扣分；其他請假 每小時扣總分1分，遲到1次扣總分0.5 分。)
***無論假別，請假或缺課總時數達8小時(含)以上者，成績不及格

課程概述
本課程主要是藉由羽球基本技巧的教學與簡易比賽，帶領初學者複習羽球運動。
1.基本技術：握拍、執球、熟悉球感、簡易步法、發球、正手高遠長球、平球、切球、網前小
球、挑球、撲球。
2.綜合技術：分組個人排名賽，雙打友誼賽，比賽可以增進基本技術的應用性，增加樂趣與
挑戰性。
歡迎對羽球運動有興趣者及初階學習者參加課程 ( 非初學者需多協助初學者 )。
課程目標
1.認識初階羽球運動。
2.學習羽球初階基本技巧。
3.學習羽球初階基本技戰術應用單、雙打比賽練習。
4.享受打羽球運動、練習比賽、擔任裁判、啦啦隊...等樂趣與分責技巧練習。
5.交朋友。
課程要求
本課程如新冠疫情嚴重便無加簽，如疫情趨緩，則視場地情況彈加幾位，課中協商、抽學生證 (身著運動服、室內球鞋、自備球拍與自備1筒球的同學，有資格進行抽籤)(可自行與欲退選者協商交換，需當日進行完畢)。教師當天給加簽授權碼，請於盡快當天課程中完成登錄 (加選時請留下基本資料及確定有索取授權碼)。可有2位有羽球經驗者，協助班級課務，需自備球拍與羽球。已選上課程者第1次上課無故未出席(含遲到15分鐘以上)未告知緣由者視為退選(上課15分鐘後點名，無故未出席者視為退選名額，提供當天補抽籤)。課程參與從第一周開始，謝謝配合! !
請上課同學穿著運動服裝、室內球鞋(羽球鞋為佳)、備好羽球球拍、羽球1筒、水、毛巾..等，當天參與抽籤的同學亦同。
一、 本體育課程上課注意事項：
1. 需填寫成績表（需照片乙張(可看出個人影像之生活照即可)，請於第一次、第二次上課帶來）。
2. 室內課程需著室內羽球鞋（或僅在室內穿著之室內運動鞋），禁止穿著高跟鞋、皮鞋或室外球鞋(請妥善處理)(綜合體育館規定)。
3. 教室內請勿飲食(綜合體育館規定)。
4. 上課請穿著吸汗棉質運動服裝、以專門服裝為佳，請勿穿著牛仔衣褲上課。
5. 請自行攜帶個人毛巾、水、保暖外套及換洗衣物。
6. 上課時(非必要時)請關手機，或轉成震動，以避免影響他人上課。
7. 本課程需要學生請保持上課場所清潔及良好學習態度(為要)。
8. 如遇缺課，請自行詢問同學當日課程訊息，以免影響自己課程順利進行。

6.能與他人互助合作精神 (利他服務練習)

課程概述
這是一堂延續並深化過去所學之羽球基本技術與經驗建構的體育課；故需修課者於課餘安排至少一小時的羽球課外練習，以增加對技術更多的身體感悟並提升體適能，更期能因技術建構系統化而作為自身或社交休閒的健康活動!!!
整學期課程內容主要有:
一、羽球運動發展簡史、賽制、著名賽事、球場禮節
二、羽球運動的場地設備與器材
三、羽球單打基本技術、比賽簡要規則、裁判法
四、分組單打循環比賽、跨組挑戰賽
五、基本技術測驗
六、每周至少一小時的課外羽球技能自我練習，以增加對羽球運動更多的身體感悟並期能作為自身或社交休閒的健康活動
課程目標
一、了解羽球運動的知識與技能
二、培養羽球單打運動的基本常識與動作技能
三、鍛鍊健康體適能、享受運動樂趣
四、培養終身運動習慣與 運動社交技巧
五、增進羽球運動美感體驗與欣賞能力
課程要求
一、 請準時上課，並在7 :30前吃過均衡早餐，且完成排毒動作，非誠勿試!
二、上課須穿著能排/吸汗、貼身且利於伸展的運動服裝、球鞋 (勿穿襯衫和休閒褲或運動拖鞋)。
三、請自備球拍、一筒練習球；每周須設法練習該周單元主題之羽球技術一小時，並可於下一周登記，10~12次。
四、上課時可準備手機，利於自我練習時之動作錄影。
五、遲到總比不到好!
無法到課者，請務必上網請假。若點名不到且未請假者以曠課論。曠課每小時扣總分4分(且扣分無下限)；有證明之公假、 喪假、防疫假、生理假不扣分；其他請假
每小時扣總分1分，遲到1次扣總分0.5 分。 ***無論何種假別，請假(含曠課)時數累計達8小時(含)以上者，成績不及格。

課程概述
本課程主要是藉由羽球基本技巧的教學與簡易比賽，帶領初學者複習羽球運動。
1.基本技術：握拍、執球、熟悉球感、簡易步法、發球、正手高遠長球、平球、切球、網前小
球、挑球、撲球。
2.綜合技術：分組個人排名賽，雙打友誼賽，比賽可以增進基本技術的應用性，增加樂趣與
挑戰性。
歡迎對羽球運動有興趣者及初階學習者參加課程 ( 非初學者需多協助初學者 )。
課程目標
1.認識初階羽球運動。
2.學習羽球初階基本技巧。
3.學習羽球初階基本技戰術應用單、雙打比賽練習。
4.享受打羽球運動、練習比賽、擔任裁判、啦啦隊...等樂趣與分責技巧練習。
5.交朋友。
課程要求
本課程如新冠疫情嚴重便無加簽，如疫情趨緩，則視場地情況彈加幾位，課中協商、抽學生證 (身著運動服、室內球鞋、自備球拍與自備1筒球的同學，有資格進行抽籤)(可自行與欲退選者協商交換，需當日進行完畢)。教師當天給加簽授權碼，請於盡快當天課程中完成登錄 (加選時請留下基本資料及確定有索取授權碼)。可有2位有羽球經驗者，協助班級課務，需自備球拍與羽球。已選上課程者第1次上課無故未出席(含遲到15分鐘以上)未告知緣由者視為退選(上課15分鐘後點名，無故未出席者視為退選名額，提供當天補抽籤)。課程參與從第一周開始，謝謝配合! !
請上課同學穿著運動服裝、室內球鞋(羽球鞋為佳)、備好羽球球拍、羽球1筒、水、毛巾..等，當天參與抽籤的同學亦同。
一、 本體育課程上課注意事項：
1. 需填寫成績表（需照片乙張(可看出個人影像之生活照即可)，請於第一次、第二次上課帶來）。
2. 室內課程需著室內羽球鞋（或僅在室內穿著之室內運動鞋），禁止穿著高跟鞋、皮鞋或室外球鞋(請妥善處理)(綜合體育館規定)。
3. 教室內請勿飲食(綜合體育館規定)。
4. 上課請穿著吸汗棉質運動服裝、以專門服裝為佳，請勿穿著牛仔衣褲上課。
5. 請自行攜帶個人毛巾、水、保暖外套及換洗衣物。
6. 上課時(非必要時)請關手機，或轉成震動，以避免影響他人上課。
7. 本課程需要學生請保持上課場所清潔及良好學習態度(為要)。
8. 如遇缺課，請自行詢問同學當日課程訊息，以免影響自己課程順利進行。
二、基礎簡要要求*：
1.對羽球運動有興趣
2.請自備羽球拍與羽球 (1筒球)*
3.請準時上課 (可提早到場暖身為佳)
4.請穿著合適的運動服裝與室內球鞋 (羽球鞋為佳)
5.請學習態度良好 (能協助課程順利進行)
6.能與他人互助合作精神 (利他服務練習)

課程概述
本課程主要是以指導學生如何從事以「自我、情緒與動機」等主題之研究問題並能付之執行為導向，希望同學從如何閱讀「自我、情緒、與動機」等心理學相關理論之學術文獻、如何呈現或報告研究心得、如何評估判斷他人提出之研究問題的適當性等實際參與歷程中，逐步能夠建構出自己的研究議題與計畫架構，並付諸執行與實證目標為本的課程重點。
課程目標
在授課方向上，除了針對「自我、情緒與動機」等課題理論建構與實徵研究間的關聯如何相互銜接為訴求外，也將針對其在性格與社會心理學、本土心理學的定位做延伸探討，使同學對選定主題之議題的重要內容及研究方法有一定程度的認識外，同時也可增進同學對研究主題的認識、思考、設計與執行等與學術研究相關基礎能力，並熟悉口頭與書面學術發表的進行方式與格式。
課程要求
擋修:需已經修過「性格心理學、社會心理學與發展心理學」者，才可選修(特殊情形者可找老師討論)
上課要求:
1. 上課方式採由修課學生帶著自己的研究主題及其想法，輪流報告自己研究主題相關文獻內容，並針對自己研究議題提出問題進行深度討論。每位同學都需要選定自己研究主題進行個人的研究進度報告，並參與他人報告內容之討論。
2. 每次上課時由2-3位修課同學負責報告自己需事先準備的報告內容(或投影片內容)、提出討論問題，並經由授課老師提問及相關建議意見，其他修課同學也必須參與報告者之問題討論。
若對課程相關有疑問者，請寫ykh01@gate.sinica.edu.tw    與授課老師聯繫

課程概述
自媒體時代，具備出色的文字表達能力，將成為充分發揮個人影響力的最佳利器。本課程將先介紹描寫、敘述、說明、議論四種寫作類型的特性和語言表現模式，再依序講授「微寫作」、「一般暨求職自傳」、「企劃書」、「評論與導讀」等多種主題文章的撰寫原則，期望藉此引導同學妥善運用文字，展現個人特質與思想，彰顯獨特性。
課程目標
1.透過多種寫作練習，使學生能因應不同的寫作目的及文章屬性，掌握最適當的溝通表達方式。
2.經由同儕討論與回饋，培養學生的讀者意識。
3.藉由習作觀摩與教師的批改回應，讓學生熟悉中文語法特性，增進寫作自覺與自我編修能力。

課程概述
"Leadership Practice by Self-Coaching" course is a dynamic and empowering exploration tailored for GMBA students with seasoned professional backgrounds. Aspiring leaders recognize the pivotal role of effective leadership in propelling businesses towards success. Yet, the quest for practical skills and profound insights to excel as leaders persists. This course introduces a transformative journey that integrates self-coaching methodologies into the fabric of leadership development. Through three pivotal dimensions - Leading Self, Leading Team, and Leading Business - participants delve into essential leadership competencies while mastering the art of self-coaching. This holistic approach empowers individuals to navigate complexities, cultivate self-awareness, and unleash their full leadership potential.
課程目標
課程要求
The course will primarily be conducted in-class, with a hybrid teaching model available if needed. Regardless of the delivery method, students must attend all class sessions as the topics covered are interconnected. To enhance understanding, pre-class readings will be provided in electronic format via NTUCOOL. It is essential to review these materials before each session.
Furthermore, all students must complete a self-assessment tool known as the CliftonStrength Assessment, which comes at a personal cost of approximately NTD 500. This assessment is a valuable part of the course and helps students gain insights into their strengths as leaders.
In addition to the assessments, the course includes several assignments to promote effective learning. These assignments encompass both individual tasks and team-based projects. Students are expected to complete these assignments after each class to reinforce their understanding and apply the concepts learned in practical scenarios.

課程簡介影片
核心能力關聯
本課程尚未建立核心能力關連
課程大綱
為確保您我的權利,請尊重智慧財產權及不得非法影印
課程概述
一. 課程概要
棲地保育長久以來即是自然資源管理，特別是生物多樣性保育最重要的方法，其最常使用的方式就是設立自然保護區。現代自然保護區的典範始於美國黃石國家公園的設立，而普遍為世界各國所採用。然而，黃石國家公園大面積、中央集權隔離式的管理模式，在釵h國家與地區並無法達到預期的目標。近二、三十年來，新的典範紛紛崛起，特別是以地方社區為主的參與式管理模式，重視社會人文面向，開啟了廣度的思考。現今的自然保護區的管理已跨越自然科學，如生物、生態、自然地理，與社會人文科學，如：人類學、社會學、經濟學與政治學等學科。不僅與生物多樣性保育息息相關，更與鄉間及少數族群的發展有密切的關係。本課程從自然保護區的定義與演進開始介紹，討論各種不同的管理思維，其蘊含的論述基礎與其社會意涵。在課程的後段，透過管理計畫的擬定與實例說明，探討自然保護區管理上的各項議題。
二. 主要課程內容如次：
1.課程介紹, 說明課程大綱與內容、瞭解學生背景與需求，協調與調整教學方式與內容
2.環境倫理與保育思維
3.自然保護區的演化史
4.定義、種類與弁遄]IUCN的管理目錄與台灣的自然保護區體系）
5.轉折與挑戰—科技至上主義的迷思、集權隔離式的反省、多元主義的興起
6.自然保護區的選擇與劃設
7.規劃、擬訂管理計畫
8.管理計畫的執行與評估
9.環境影評估與保護區
10.解說與環境溝通
11.伙伴與參與
12.在地社群與保護區
13.原住民族與保護區
14.生態旅遊

課程概述
生物多樣性的喪失 (biodiversity loss)，成為近年人類社會所不得不面對並且提出因應辦法的風險之一。根據聯合國開發計畫署(United Nations Development Programme, UNDP)所綜整的資訊，全球約32億人口 (占全球人口的40%)，受到土地退化的不利影響，另因沿海棲息地的破壞，1-3億的人口正處於面臨洪澇等災害增加的危險境。此外，世界經濟論壇（World Economic Forum, WEF）於2023年1月發布之2023全球風險報告(The Global Risks Report 2023)指出全球系統無論在短期及長期，皆面臨自然發展相關的危機。自然損失與氣候變遷是連動的若當前之政策或投資行為無重大改變，氣候變遷影響、生物多樣性喪失、糧食安全及自然資源消耗等事件之間的相互作用，將加速生態系統崩潰，進而威脅氣候脆弱度較高的經濟體之糧食供應與生計，並擴大自然災害影響，限制氣候變遷減緩的進程。
自然相關財務揭露(TNFD)於2021成立，由全球樹冠層（Global Canopy）組織、聯合國開發計畫署（United Nations Development Programme, UNDP）、聯合國環境保護署財務倡議組織（United Nations Environment Programme Finance Initiative, UNEP FI）以及世界自然基金會（World Wide Fund for Nature, WWF）等四個國際重量級機構共同推行。該倡議主要目標為：建立一個風險管理和揭露框架，所有司法管轄區內各種規模的組織都可以使用該框架來識別、評判、管理和揭露與自然相關的依存度、影響、風險和機會。截至2023年3月，TNFD公布beta 4.0版的框架準則，刻正進行市場諮詢中，預計於2023年9月發布正式版準則。
TNFD v0.4測試版將其核心架構分為三部分，最內層由核心概念與定義、風險與機會評估方法及揭露建議等三個項目所組成，第二層為數據、指標及目標加上情境指南，最外層為其他指南。
TNFD納入風險與機會評估方法，簡稱LEAP：供非金融及金融機構透過定位（Locate）、評估（Evaluate）、評判（Assess）以及準備（Prepare）四個階段，評估自然相關之依賴度、影響、風險與機會，是決定是否可完善TNFD報告的重要環節。實務上LEAP分析是整個TNFD報告中最具挑戰的部分，不但需要良好的評估方法，更重要是要有足以進行分析的各種生物多樣性資料。因此目前TNFD結合18個知識合作夥伴強化分析知識，並透過自然相關資料整合機制，提供市場對有關自然相關風險和機會的高品質、可信、對決策有用的資訊和數據的需求。當然、更重要的是如何判讀分析結果，成為後續執行各項策略的基礎。
最後，依據LEAP分析結果，TNFD從治理、策略、風險影響與管理亟指標與目標等四個面向，需要揭露14項揭露露事項，讓外部瞭解該企業對自然相關風險之治理。
課程目標
1.	理解生物多樣性挑戰與機會，掌握自然保育趨勢
2.	認知TNFD發展之必然性及其後續發展之潛力。
3.	熟悉LEAP風險評估方法，並能具體執行其分析步驟。
4.	具有解讀LEAP風險評判能力，並能發展風險管理的必要策略。
5.	具備自然相關財務揭露知識，並能進行有效揭露。

課程概述
In this course, we will delve into the multifaceted realm of human behaviour within organisations. We will explore fundamental concepts that define groups and teams, learn about the role of leadership in shaping organisational culture and structure, and gain insights into effective methods for collaboration.
Through a combination of case studies and real case examples, this course will equip you with the tools to understand and navigate the complex dynamics of organisations. You will learn to identify and analyse various individual and group behaviours and develop strategies to leverage diversity and enhance performance. This course is designed for all GMBA students and aims to provide relevant knowledge and skills to help you become better managers and leaders.
課程目標
After completing this course, students will be able:
‧	Describe current understandings of organizational behaviour.
‧	Be able to identify the building blocks that define the workplace settings.
‧	Apply frameworks, tools, and concepts that can improve an organisations effectiveness for all internal stakeholders.
‧	Better manage employees.
‧	Manage organizational change from a managerial perspective.

課程概述
本課程為手作課程，介紹企業經營管理的實務流程，並以MIT APP Inventor 2 (MIT AI2)圖形化程式語言動手開發行動APP。本課程提供MIT AI2設計樣式程式碼(對照Python程式碼)供同學參考，同學可實作各種商務應用，包括報表查詢、單據查詢、B2C銷售、B2B銷售、VMI採購、B2B採購、資料分析等。
課程目標
The objective of this learning-by-doing course is to provide students with the concepts and skills to align business processes and information technology by applying enterprise cloud services and sensors of the mobile phone. The topics include service-oriented architecture (SOA) concept, cloud computing concept, Web services, citizen development, and MIT APP Inventor. An SOA-ERP cloud service system is used for demonstration, discussion, and development. Students will have hands-on experience in APP development based on existing SOA-ERP cloud services.

課程概述
This course is designed for doctoral students who need a significant familiarity with those statistical techniques known collectively as "structural equation modeling (SEM)," "causal modeling," or "analysis of covariance structures," along with related techniques.  SEM is a generalized statistical procedure that can be used for many purposes, such as confirmatory factor analysis, path analysis, and causal models. It is excellent for comparing groups, examining longitudinal data, and dealing with multilevel analysis.  SEMs basically refer to a bunch of similar models developed by different scholars (e.g., LISREL, AMOS, PLS, MPlus, EQS, CALIS, etc.)  Specifically, this course introduces the LISREL (Linear Structural Relationships) modeling techniques, which are very useful in dealing with substantive problems in behavioral sciences and marketing.
Applications of LISREL can be found almost everywhere.  LISREL is powerful in areas like measurement and hypothesis testing.  With respect to measurement, it is capable of examining reliability, dimensions of constructs, and validity.  As for hypothesis testing, it produces parameter estimates and goodness-of-fit indices which can be used for testing of assumptions, theory verification, or even comparison of competing models.  People who use survey or experimental design will find the LISREL methodology applicable to a wide range of models such as exploratory and confirmatory factor analysis, path analysis, and econometric models for time series data.
課程目標
The primary objective of this class is to give students: (1) the ability to recognize situations where these techniques may be useful in research; (2) an appreciation for the roles of theory and sound measurement in making these techniques useful; (3) an understanding of the limitations of these methods; (4) the ability to use available software in conducting research; (5) the ability to critique the use of these techniques in published research; and (6) hopefully by the end of the term, you will have the ability to meet the advanced technical requirements for publication in academic journals related to SEMs.
課程要求
The format for this course will be primarily lecturing.  Examples drawn from marketing, behavioral sciences, psychology, organizational science, corporate strategy, international management and other related fields will be used to illustrate the ideas.  This course does not involve a high level of mathematical sophistication, but a basic understanding of statistics and multivariate techniques is required.  Theoretically, the course couldn't be too much a burden for students who don't even like quantitative methods.  A sincere desire to learn is considered more important.
Students taking this course for credit should form study groups.  Details on the formation of study groups will be announced in class.   Since this is a course on methodology, all participants in this class should at least learn how to run the PC version of LISREL.  A couple of LISREL sample models, mainly from academic journals, are used as homework exercises.  These exercises should be run and analyzed on group basis.  Some additional papers will also be distributed to students in order to increase their familiarity with the LISREL methodology, and each group will be asked to present papers, summarize their major findings, and provide critiques.  The technical sophistication of these papers will be kept at minimum, and they usually represent important pieces of ongoing research.

課程概述
Integrated marketing communication is a critical component of marketing strategy and vital to any business’s success. This seminar is designed to provide graduate students with an introduction to topics in marketing communications from the perspective of consumer psychology, especially for those students who are interested in pursuing a thesis topic in the advertising, promotion, and/or consumer psychology area.
課程目標
The purposes of this seminar are twofold: 1) to aid in the understanding of the scope, perspectives, and methods of research in advertising and persuasion; and 2) to assist in the identification of research streams viable for future research.
課程要求
The format for this class is similar to that of any doctoral level seminar. Readings from academic literature are assigned which will form the background for discussions in class. Each of the assigned paper will be presented by one student (i.e., one paper per student), but all students will be expected to read every paper so that we can discuss each article in depth.
For each paper, the presenter should use PowerPoint to make a 40-minute presentation. Then the paper will be thrown open for 30-40 minute discussion by all participants.
The presentation must address the following issues:
1.	Research questions/research purposes: Itemize the research questions or research purposes of this paper. Why are these questions important (academically and managerially)? How does this article fit within the broader stream of research in marketing?
2.	Contributions: Summarize and list the key contributions of the paper.
3.	The proposed model and hypotheses: What are the theoretical basis of the paper? What theory is used to build up the conceptual model of the paper? How is every hypothesis derived?
4.	Research method: Describe data collection method. Identify the independent and dependent variables and how they are manipulated and/or measured.
5.	Results: Use tables and/or figures to illustrate the major findings. (Do not dwell on small details!)
6.	Limitations and future research: What are the research limitations? Outline the research suggestions forwarded by the authors.
During discussion, all students are expected to express YOUR comments on the paper, for example:
-  What do you like about the paper?
-  What did you think could have been done differently/better?
-  Are there any alternate explanations to the results?
-  Are the research limitations fully recognized?
-  Which of the future research directions suggested by the authors is particularly worthy of pursuing? Why?
- What may be some specific future research directions, in addition to those suggested by the authors?
Responsibilities of the presenter include:
1. make a 40-minute presentation of the assigned paper of the week.
2. find one more paper which cites the assigned article as reference, and make a brief summary of this paper at the end of their presentation.
3. submit or upload a copy of their PowerPoint slides before the class.
Responsibilities of the non-presenter include:
1. submit a one-page note focusing on either one research idea that emanates from the week’s readings, or one research limitation that is not recognized by the authors. The purpose of this assignment is to encourage you to think generatively and critically while reading.
2. actively participate in class discussion.
Term Paper:
The purpose of the term paper is to give the student the opportunity to develop a specific research topic and to become familiar with the stages of development of a research proposal. The paper can focus on an issue concerning advertising, promotion, or more general marketing with communication implications. This 4000-5000 word proposal should include the following sections: Introduction/Objectives, Literature Review, Conceptual Model and Hypotheses, and Methodology. Collecting data and reporting results are optional.
Please present your paper in class on December 9, 2024. The term paper should be submitted to the instructor on December 16, 2024.

The objectives of the course are to introduce you to marketing concepts and strategies, and to familiarize you with the elements of marketing mix. Moreover, through the discussion of cases included in the text, we hope to sharpen your skills for critical analytical thinking and effective communication. 課程要求
加簽規範(2024/08/23 更)
- 有意願加簽的同學，請在第一堂課到授課教室

Group Case Write-Up:
Three cases (see the class schedule below) in the text will be discussed in class. You will form groups of six to seven members to analyze cases. All members in each group need to discuss and analyze those cases in advance. There will be within-group peer evaluation for all group assignments (cases and final project); we may adjust members’ scores on group assignments based on the evaluation. Group case-write-ups and power point files for the cases are due at 5pm of Wednesday of the corresponding weeks in which the respective cases will be discussed. Also, one group will be randomly chosen to present their analysis in class (in less than 6-10 minutes, depending on the number of v-group chosen). One or two volunteer groups will be selected to present their analyses in class (in 8-15 minutes). The credits given to the volunteer group will depend on the quality of the presentation. All groups also have to upload its power point files (For groups which do not volunteer, only three slides need be prepared). Late reports will not be accepted. The length of the group case-write-ups cannot exceed 10 pages. Depending on the course schedule and contents of teaching materials, I might adopt remote teaching to complement classroom teaching and case discussions.
To have more seven members, you need to have my approval. Depending on the number of registered students,
we might adjust the number of members per group whenever necessary.
Final Project:
In order to apply what you have learned in the course to real marketing issues, each group has to conduct some marketing analysis for its chosen target company in Taiwan. Some preliminary thoughts about your final projects are due on Oct. 9, 2024 (Wednesday). The written reports will be due and uploaded before 5pm on Dec. 11, 2024 (Wednesday.). Each group should be prepared to present its analytical results in class one week before the final. More will be discussed in the process of the course.

課程概述
The course is designed to help the students learn the basic concepts of modern marketing in a management-orientation way. The most basic objectives of this course are to provide you with a broad introduction to marketing concepts, the role of marketing in society and in the firm, and the various factors that influence marketing decision-making.
You will be expected to familiarize with the ‘language of marketing’ (i.e., terms, concepts, and frameworks) used by practicing marketing managers, and have a solid understanding of the major decision area under marketing responsibility. It focuses on major decisions that marketing managers may face in their efforts to harmonize the objectives and resources of the organization with the needs and opportunities in the marketplace. Within time limits, this class attempts to cover all the topics that a marketing manager needs to face in strategic, tactical, and administrative marketing.
課程目標
The objective of this courses are
1.To familiarize the students with the marketing concepts and techniques, and to develop skills in using a variety of analytical frameworks to implement such techniques.
2.To develop the skills in organizing an effective marketing management strategy in a real business world.
By the end of the course, you should be able to apply the key frameworks and tools for analyzing customers, competition, and marketing strength and weakness. The class materials should also help you to develop insights about creative selection of target markets and blending the marketing mix decisions to maintain competitive positions and serve customer needs.

課程概述
This course is designed to help the students learn the basic concepts of modern marketing in a management-orientation way.  You will be expected to familiarize with the “language of marketing” (i.e., terms, concepts, and frameworks) used by practicing marketing managers, and have a solid understanding of the major decision areas under marketing responsibility.  It focuses on major decisions that marketing managers face in their efforts to harmonize the objectives and resources of the organization with the needs and opportunities in the marketplace.
課程目標
The objectives of this course are:
1) to familiarize the students with the marketing concepts and techniques, and to develop skills in using a variety of analytical frameworks to implement such techniques;
2) to develop the skills in organizing an effective marketing management strategy in a real business world. By the end of this course, you should be able to apply the key frameworks and tools for analyzing customers, competition, and marketing strengths and weaknesses. The class materials should also help you to develop insights about creative selection of target markets and blending the marketing mix decisions to maintain competitive positions and serve customer needs.
課程要求
Exams:
There will be two exams (one midterm and one final). The exams may include multiple choice and essay questions drawing from the text, lectures, group project presentations, and class discussions. There will be no make-up exams, except in case of illness/emergency and provided you notify the instructor prior to exam time.
Individual Assignments:
Read the Gucci Case (the first assignment) and Chase Sapphire Case (the second assignment) in your textbook. For each assignment/case, write a report (max. 2 pages) that would answer the questions posted by the instructor.
Class Participation
Participation during class is crucial because it is an important avenue for learning. Students are expected to be active in every class session discussion by answering questions posed by the instructor or other classmates, making an insightful comment regard the discussion topics, or asking an insightful question that triggers additional discussion.
In order to facilitate evaluation of your contribution to class discussion, please make a name card for yourself and have your name card in front of you for every class. The teaching assistant will document the quality and quantity of your participation.
Should you have to be absent from one of the class sessions, please notify the instructor and the TA in advance, and file an on-line application of Student Leave of Absence (學生請假系統)。
Group Case Analysis:
Two cases will be discussed in class this semester. You will form groups of 5 to 7 members to analyze the cases and write a 5-page case report. Each group should upload their report to the course website by 5pm of the day before the class (i.e., Monday) in which the corresponding case will be discussed. Late reports will not be accepted.
Your analyses are to be based exclusively on information presented in the case, focusing on analysis and solutions rather than repeating case facts. Study questions for each case will be provided on NTU COOL.
In addition, one group will make a 20-minute in-class presentation of its analysis. The case presentation will be followed by a 40-minute discussion session, which is the time for other teams to challenge the presentation group by offering alternative solutions/points-of-view, and for the presentation group to defend its analysis and recommendations. At the end, the instructor will spend 10 minutes on summarizing the discussion and drawing out the useful lessons and observations that come from the case problem and from the class discussion. The presentation team and the challenge teams will be randomly selected if no team volunteers.
Use any audiovisual resource your team believes to be helpful for the case presentation. Extra credit will be given to the group which volunteers to make in-class presentation, provided that the quality of the presentation is good.
Group Project: Marketing Plan
Each group will develop a marketing plan for some existing or planned profit oriented or non-profit business. Preferably, you will select a company/product that you know about or wish to know more about. You may interview company employees and report what you discovered as part of your Marketing Plan.
The Marketing Plan should cover all aspects of marketing as it relates to the business, i.e. products, services, packaging, brand name, target market, promotion, price, channels, etc., and, of course, the marketing mix for the product line(s) of the business. Please refer to Chapter 2 of your textbook for a template for writing a marketing plan. A sample marketing plan will be posted on NTU COOL .
Also, each team should make a midterm presentation of your project idea on October 29. Detailed instructions for the midterm presentation will be  provided on NTU COOL 公告欄.

課程目標
The objectives of the course are to introduce you to marketing concepts, and strategies and to familiarize you with the elements of marketing mix. Moreover, through the discussion of cases, we hope to sharpen your skills for critical analytical thinking and effective communication. 課程要求
Group Case Write-Ups:
You will form groups of six to seven to analyze three cases (see the class schedule below). There will be within-group peer evaluation for all group assignments (cases and final project); we may adjust members’ scores on group assignments based on the evaluation.  Each group need discuss and analyze those cases in advance. Moreover, the power point files of group case analysis for the cases are due at 5pm of Tuesday of the corresponding weeks in which the respective cases will be discussed. The group(s) which volunteers to present has to e-mail its power point files to your TA and to me before 5pm. Also, one group might be randomly chosen to present their analysis in class (in less than 6-10 minutes, depending on the number of v-group chosen). One or two volunteer groups will be selected to present their analyses in class. The credits given to the volunteer group will depend on the quality of the presentation. All groups also have to upload its power point files. The number of ppt slides cannot exceed 12 pages. Depending on new developments of coronavirus, I might rely on remote teaching to complement classroom teaching and case discussions.
Optional Final Project on one selected case in Taiwan：
In order to apply what you have learned in the course to real marketing issues, you need to provide comments on another relevant case in Taiwan you selected after analyzing each case: The implications from each case analysis may be applicable to another company in Taiwan (which could be an international one). Give your recommendations to that company for its related issues based on the lessons or implications learned from the case analysis. In the (optional) final project, your group will follow up one company in Taiwan you selected from relevant cases through the three cases and conduct analysis of depth for some important marketing issue it faces (e.g., the selection of target market, or design its digital advertising strategy, or any one element in its marketing mix) and provide analysis of depth in your final project. Some preliminary thoughts about your optional final projects are due on Oct. 12 (Wednesday), 2022. The written reports of the final projects will be due before 5pm on Dec. 13 (Tuesday), 2022. All groups that like to pursue the optional final projects have to present their analytical results in class on Dec. 15, 2022. More will be discussed in the process of the course.

課程概述
Mobile and pervasive intelligence enables diverse smart applications in our daily life. It provides new insights into unstructured and uncertain information from a variety of sensors, data sources, user devices, and mobile platforms. The lecture covers theoretical fundamentals in sensing, communications, computing, and autonomy techniques, how to apply them in practical systems, and design principles in mobile and pervasive applications. The content includes the following topics.
A: Sensation and perception of mobile platforms
‧Section 1-Sensing: Wireless, visual, acoustic, and privacy-preserving sensing techniques
‧Section 2-Communications: Advanced communication and networking technologies to connect hardware and software components in one or more pervasive systems.
B: Intelligence creation
‧Section 3-Computing: Context-aware computing, serverless computing, and distributed intelligence
‧Section 4-Autonomy: Autonomous coordination and collaboration techniques between mobile platforms (e.g., drones or robots)
C: Hands-on tutorials (含"程式設計", "實作課程")
課程目標
We expect to expand students’ capabilities from the following perspectives.
‧Establishing knowledge of advanced techniques in mobile and pervasive intelligence.
‧Decomposing dependency between SCCA* modules required by applications.
‧Optimizing the usage of SCCA resources in mobile devices and platforms.
‧Independently designing innovative and intelligent systems on mobile and smart platforms.
* SCCA: Sensing, Communications, Computing, and Autonomy.

課程概述
This course is designed to construct marketing principles and processes from conceptual knowledge leading to value creation. It focuses on the changing role of marketing in organizations today and how to effectively incorporate marketing principles into defining the business strategy.  It aims to build on the skills of students and enable them to analyze the marketing environment and utilize relevant tools useful for crafting and implementing marketing strategies in the context of various industries.
The course applies a combination of cases, discussions, lectures, class activities, and assignments to enhance students' skills in communication, analytics, critical thinking, multicultural nuances, and reflective thinking. The course materials draw from a variety of sources, including case studies and articles in various industries across the globe. The course will finally culminate into a project presented by the students.
課程目標
Analyze the market situation/environment and logically identify market opportunities.
Explore the integration of marketing concepts, principles, terms, and frameworks for creating and delivering consumer value.
Create and formulate robust market-product fit marketing strategies.
Identify and comprehend the underpinnings of consumer behaviour, and based upon this, the process of Segmenting, Targeting and Positioning.
Develop marketing plans to achieve marketing objectives and reflect on multiple aspects to achieve marketing objectives
課程要求
1.Group: You will work in groups to analyze the cases provided in the syllabus. Group work helps in the development of specific skills that are crucial determinants of success in organizations the ability to work in teams, identification, and achievement of common objectives and accommodating many points of view. The group work submissions have to be uploaded on NTU Cool or as advised in the class.
2. Attendance/ participation: Active class participation is key to your own and your classmates' learning experience, both during lectures and during case discussions. Constructive participation is based on analysis rather than opinion and builds on the discussion flow (a good participant is also a good listener). Come well prepared for the sessions. During the session, please ask clarification questions, take lead in presenting for group activities and contribute relevant examples from your own business experience.  Participation for students online would be encouraged. Use the Hand Raise symbol on Webex to participate or ask questions and speak only when asked by the professor. All group activities will be done using Breakout rooms on webex to enable all students to participate.
3.Seating: For face-to-face sessions, group members should be seated together as guided by the teaching assistant.
4.The course is built in a way to enhance learning in an online/hybrid learning environment through learning activities, cases, and assessments.

課程概述
Commercial enterprise plays a fundamental role in the age of globalization both domestically and internationally interacting with state authorities as well as agencies of international organizations. Since the 1990s, the rise of multinational corporations in economic scale and political influence has massively empowered their agency in international relations, and thus made them indispensable transnational actors and inevitably included in the strategic calculation when geopolitical competition intensified. This course will introduce and establish an understanding of the intricate relationship between commercial enterprise and government at both international and local levels.
課程目標
This course aims to offer students basic knowledge and insight of the relationship between business and government. Not only reviewing two traditional viewpoints: business lobby the government and government regulate businesses, the course will focus on how they interact with each other intentionally, as well as how both simultaneously are affected by the society. Students are expected to grasp the nuts and bolts of the intricate relationship between business and government.

課程概述
Insects made their first debut on earth 480 million years ago and have interacted with humans through a love-hate relationship. They are very fertile with enormous influence on nature. It might seem disgusting to you, but insects are a food source in many places across the globe. Depending on the association, be it parasitism, commensalism, or mutualism at the time, people decide to take action to combat or encourage insects worldwide. Although insects have various negative impacts on humans, their positive contributions far outweigh any harm they cause. They, therefore, are a necessary part of life. This course will give a general introduction and hope to clarify common misunderstandings of these six-legged creatures through in-class lectures and off-campus activities. Field trips on the NTU campus, to the NTU Insectarium, the Taiwan insect museum, and Fuyang Ecological Park will be arranged for students to observe insects commonly found in open environments and learn how to recognize them using field guide/naked eyes. Lecture topics include but are not limited to insect morphology, systematics, diversity, ecology, and behavior. Guest lectures from NTU/NCHU/NCU faculty and industry will be eye-openers.
課程目標
This course aims to help you appreciate the diversity and value of insects and gain practical information on insects of relevance to your daily life. Please take insect photos with your camera/cellphone during field trips or leisure. Using these photo collections, develop a report introducing insect diversity in Taipei. Participation in the classroom and discussion is strongly encouraged. Students will sometimes be asked to work together in groups. Through these activities, you would expect to 1) identify common insects that occurred in Taipei, 2) understand their biology and unique adaptation, and 3) recognize the physical features of insects that help them live in a different environment.
課程要求
Students are strongly encouraged to review the syllabus concerning the course carefully. Know why you are discussing this particular topic in the course. Put down whatever you have found during the field trips or personal visits to points of interest—collecting photos, recording time, locations, and surrounding conditions after each trip to complete your report. Homework will be assigned weekly. All reflections will account for 70% total grade. You must upload an insect photo to the Facebook fan page every week, with clear information and description, as you were told in the first week's lecture. The pictures and comments you took and made on facebook take up another 30%. Failure to do so will result in a zero score on your performance grade. The assignment you turn in should be neat and legible. Make sure to show sufficient work each time. Insufficient work may result in a lower score. Cutting and pasting, lazy paraphrasing, and borrowing information from the web are prohibited. Attendance is expected. If you find that you must miss class, do file the leave of absence on My NTU. You may miss up to 1 class without any excuse. After that, each unauthorized absence will lower your final grade one increment (i.e., A to A-); this policy is cumulative. Extreme emergencies arise in life, so feel free to contact me if this happens to you, but do so within a week to be excused. One may not text. Use a phone or have your laptop open for unrelated issues while I am speaking. A breach of regulations will lower your final grade by one increment (i.e., A to A-) the moment it happens.

2. Borror, D. J., and R. E., White 1970. A field guide to the insects of America north of Mexico. 404pp Peterson field guides #19.

修課動機單連結：https://forms.gle/o9HjkWWrKVU26dYM8
上課地點：臺大師資培育中心 207教室
大學為生涯探索的關鍵時期，學生需要統整過去經驗、展望未來，為自己建構適性的生涯目標。然而，許多學生對生涯認識不足或深感茫然，不知從何著手，因此本課程將提供整全的生涯視角與多元的方法，引導學生了解自身的特質、環境趨勢與未來發展，以更有效地探索與建構其生涯。
老師安排於09/06 (五)中午透過線上會議室進行課程介紹，建議有意願修課的同學除了填寫修課動機單外、也參與此線上會議，能幫助你更了解課程喔！
若填寫修課動機單時有遇到任何問題，請與生命教育中心 邱詩詠助教聯繫(sychiu@lec.ntu.edu.tw)。
本密集課程停修申請截止日期：2024/09/16 (一)
課程目標
1.	學生能掌握生涯與生命探索的完整架構
2.	學生能重新審視自身的生涯路徑並建構自身生涯意義 (生涯發展與建構)
3.	學生能盤點自身特質與優勢並掌握決定策略 (生涯適配與決定)
4.	學生能正視與善用機緣創造可能性 (生涯機緣)
5.	學生能與重要他人溝通自身生涯方向與行動
